review.reviewBody: The canopy leaked at the seams. I purchased this product to keep dry while smoking. It didn't work out so well.
review.name: Got wet
comment:
Hello Ewand!
Thank you very much for your feedback! It definitely should not have happened! We sincerely apologize!
We would like to have a chance to make this right for you, that is why we strongly encourage you to reach out to us directly via our official "Contact Us" page on our website.
https://www.coleman.com/support/contact-us
Thank you!
Coleman Consumer Care.

Hello.

Thank you for providing feedback on our OASIS™ Lite 7 x 7 Canopy. We are very sorry to hear that the canopy leaked at the seams, this is not the kind of experience we want you to have at all. Your feedback is valuable to us and it will be forwarded to the appropriate department for further review.

Your OASIS™ Lite 7 x 7 Canopy has a 1- Year Limited Warranty, to initiate the warranty claim, please follow this link: https://www.coleman.com/warranty-information.html.

If you require further assistance, please do not hesitate to get in touch with us directly.

Reach out to us via our website or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9am - 5pm Eastern Time.

Thank you!
Coleman® Consumer Care

review.reviewBody:
ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE! 
i recieved the box from the mail, within 3 minutes i had the canopy up, just push 4 buttons and the canopy is down, and ready to FIT into the BAG "WITH WHEELS" and trust me, it fits, EVERYTIME, the canopy might be waterproof! it looks like its waterproof, im so happy you all dont understand, you can just take the canopy off in 5 seconds, if you want you can put up and down all day long and put into a bag with wheels and just live your best life! thank you coleman for finally getting the canopy tent 100% right 110% ! no pinch points, from 10 years old to 90 years old, you can pitch this canopy, with ease.
review.name: THE TRUTH HAS SPOKEN

review.reviewBody: Great canopy overall! Lightweight, easy to set up and take down, even 1-person, the bag has wheels to haul it around. Really helps me to stay protected from the sun during competition shooting in triple digits Texas weather.
review.name: Great, sturdy canopy!

review.reviewBody: Impressed. Frame is sturdy. The carry case has wheels for rolling and handles for carrying which make it quite convenient. But, it's the one touch center piece which raises/lowers canopy that makes this one stand out from competitors. I use canopy on trips alone and in pressing that one center piece, it allows me to setup this canopy easily by myself. I'm thrilled in how easy it is to do. I would have purchased a long time ago if I would have known how this canopy takes little effort to setup. I would definitely recommend this product.
review.name: Great Canopy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a durable and long lasting canopy. We got it to manage a backyard birthday get together for our young daughter. Interestingly the day we had the party, it started pouring. The canopy held the rain perfectly and the event went smooth with no hiccups. It was easy to also store and pack it away for easy to use the time onwards. We have also used it a few times on our travel and it occupies minimal space for carrying as well. Easy to use and easy to setup within minutes for the adventurers.
review.name: Durable and long lasting

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used this for an outdoor birthday party and I'm glad I did so, because this provided good shade and was big enough to put a couple tables and a bunch of chairs under!! It also provided somewhere to go when it started to rain out a little bit and kept things under it dry !!
review.name: Provides great shade and enough space

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was so excited to get this Coleman pop up canopy for camping and my kids sports events. Right out of the box it’s a lot lighter than expected. You literally pull it out and pop it open with one push. So easy! It also comes 
with stakes so it doesn’t blow away. Take down is also very simple. It’s pinch free push of a button and even has a rolling case. I would highly recommend.
review.name: Super convenient

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've been using the Coleman lite canopy tent for the last several weeks and love it. Small and compact to easily throw in the car. Set up is simple, I knock it out in 5-10 minutes every time with minimal effort. Overhand is nice for when it rains as we get less drops in the tent. Highly recommend!
review.name: Great tent, extra durable!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This canopy is amazing! It is so compact and easy to set up. The size is perfect for my family of 4 as went to the beach and had it set up in about 5 minutes. I live the size as it makes it easy to carry and my daughters and I can easily put it and take it down ourselves. Definitely recommend this shade maker!!
review.name: Great canopy!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This canopy is amazing. It is lightweight sturdy, Design makes it very capable of being deployed anywhere quickly. Setup was fast and easy. A great way to protect yourself from the sun's UV RAY'S.  I  Highly recommend this to family and friends.
review.name: Nice and Easy setup

name: 7X7 Oasis Lite Canopy + Onepeak

review.reviewBody: I ordered a size down from what I normally wear and this shirt is huge! Arms are at least 4" too long. And it is a very heavy material. And it is napped on one side only. The inside is smooth, the outside is like felt. Fired Brick is a nice color but before I can wear it the sleeves will have to be shortened as the smooth inside is not attractive so I can't just roll them up. Also the fabric is so heavy that it would not roll up well. All in all it is a nice shirt but the description is lacking clarity. I never would have purchased it if I had known how huge it runs or that the fabric was napped on one side only and that the fabric is so heavy.
review.name: Very large!

review.reviewBody: Bad experience with the product and with Backcountry. Bought the boots and they arrived with clear previous use. Sent them back and requested a refund, since I disliked the fit. The company policy says 3-5 business days for refunds, yet I had to call after 6 biz days, since apparently no one had sent a refund. Very negative experience with Backcountry
review.name: Boots bought were not new, terrible CX

review.reviewBody: Not covering any new ground here but, as predicted, this wasn't a great fit for me with wide feet.  I tried both this and the Scarpa Phantom 6000 and those were soooo much more comfortable.  It's a shame because these boots seemed potentially warmer (or at the very least, had a stiffer/beefier inner boot) and I loooooved the BOA system.  But fit comes first.
review.name: hurt ankle bone, tight toe box

review.reviewBody:
I like the look of them, but they are just too narrow for my feet. I have size 10 1/2 wide feet and with the lining inside my little toes were completely numb in about 10 minutes of walking. So i took them out and realized ill need about 3 layers of socks to not totally destroy my feet.The boa strips are really nice and do keep you secure but it seems like one extreme or the other with these. The zip up abrasion covers are an absolute pain, everything has to be lined up just perfectly or you just about rip the zipper off. I have pretty large calves naturally and I was about all these boots wanted. 

I know I sound like I'm just knocking these boots into the dirt here, but when you pay almost 1000 dollars for something it should be just about perfect.
review.name: Way too narrow for my feet and calves

review.reviewBody:
I used these to climb Lobuche next to Everest base camp. This was fixed-rope climb on varied terrain including rock, packed snow and ice with crampons. I also trained in these but mostly on stairmasters at a gym but a little on flat terrain.

I love the overall fit although I did have to buy a size and a half larger than my normal shoe size and a half size larger than my normal trekking boot. Getting my large foot (US size 13) in and out is not the easiest but certainly possible. The boa adjustments are very nice.

After 11 hours climbing up and down I will say I was happy to change into my normal trekking boots. I understand the need for stiffness - and it certainly made climbing easier and more comfortable - but for just normal walking/hiking it is too much.

The crampon attachment was easy and the fit was secure.

Overall I would highly recommend these for the purpose of climbing.
review.name: Did the job very well, comfort an issue

review.reviewBody: This boot seems warm and light for a double boot but the heel pocket was way too big for me. I tried different sock thickness's and no matter how I cranked down on the boa knobs I could not get the heel lift to a tolerable level.  I have the G5 sm in the same size and the heel lift and overall fit in that boot is manageable but not in this G2 evo. Back it goes. I guess I will stick with my aging Spantiks for now.  I don't really want to give it a star rating since the boot doesn't fit and if it fits you maybe you will like it but the software requires it.
review.name: heel pocket too big for me
comment: Hi Robert, thanks for your review! Did you try other sizes? I have the same problem with the heel and not sure if a size less will help. Thanks!

review.reviewBody: This is nice for when you want a larger non-locker but are still a little bit weight conscious. It's not the lightest in the market, but it's pretty good for what it is.
review.name: A larger carabiner that's not that heavy

review.reviewBody: The metal on these carabiners tend to acquire sharp grooves from contact with traditional expansion bolt hangers, like those from Petzl and Metolius. This is not a problem with more rounded edge glue-in anchors.
review.name: Questionable durability

review.reviewBody: I used these for my alpine and double length draws while trad climbing. A good price and design. I've used these before this most recent purchase and found value in its prices and durability. Haven't found any issues with it.

name: Crag Keylock Carabiner

review.reviewBody: The trail mix ubertube is so cozy just like the trail mix tops!  love it and can't wait to try it out this winter.
review.name: Cozy and warm

review.reviewBody: So soft and insulating! It definitely helps me on my early morning rides when I know I'll eventually warm up and don't want to have on a ton of layers on to be warm
review.name: perfect coverage

review.reviewBody: I love wearing this almost daily to keep my neck warm. I've worn this do go on daily walks as well as dogsledding in Minnesota. If I get too warm, I can easily take this off as opposed to needing to take off an entire layer.
review.name: Wear daily

review.reviewBody: Basic and warm. It saved me while snowshoeing in high winds and ice. My face and neck stayed nice and warm!
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Feels quite nice. Since it's currently 90* out, I haven't tried it yet for warmth. Not for another 4 months (but OR wants a review now). But it feels great (softer than my merino buff) and I think it's going to be great.
review.name: Soft and cozy

review.reviewBody: Love this thing. Lightweight and packable but super warm, soft and comfy.
review.name: Ubertube All Day

review.reviewBody: Nice idea, but one small size seem good for women or children.
review.name: One size fits some

review.reviewBody: These neck warmers are great for skiing and winter hiking. They are warm, comfortable, lightweight and snug. Some neck warmers I find to be too loose and bulky. These, from Outdoor Research fit well and are not too bulky. A useful little thing to put in your pocket!
review.name: Warm, snug, useful

review.reviewBody: This is the best gaitor I've ever owned and I can't imagine going back to anything else. I wore it on the first below zero ski tour of the season last week, eyebrows and hair frozen, and somehow this gaitor didn't freeze from my breath. Kept my face and nose warm the entire tour. It's also the perfect stiffness - it stays far enough away from your face to keep some air in for warmth, and it stays up over your nose while skinning/skiing. Love it.
review.name: Alaska approved! Love it

review.reviewBody: So I have multiple of these neck ubertubes! They are wonderful. The trail mix fabric is soooo soft. And they stay up over your nose and mouth nicely! I used when cross country skiing this winter on a regular basis. I hope OR makes more in other colors next winter!
review.name: Finally! A soft neck gaiter!

name: Trail Mix Ubertube

description: Buy the Camp Chef Camp Oven Carry Bag online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Camp Oven Carry Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Camp Chef Camp Oven Carry Bag online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Agreed that the bag should zip other way for easy insertion of oven. Question for ya'll.  My problem with my oven is it seems to take a long time to bake anything.  I noticed a lot of heat escapes out the back hole. I'm wondering if leaving the bag loosely around the back side would be ok? Doing this "smartly and cautiously" away from other objects in case of fire do you think it's possible to use this bag as a insulator to help keep oven at right temperature and prevent excessive heat loss?
review.name: Great quality poor design

review.reviewBody: Fits the oven perfectly. Very sturdy. Should last for years.
review.name: Camp Stove Cover is Perfect!

review.reviewBody: Oven cover is great quality, sturdy, and oven fits perfectly.  Cover handles makes it easy for lifting
review.name: Terrific oven cover

review.reviewBody: Great cover, a little overpriced, frankly, but most of all… put the zippered flap access on top so the stove can be dropped in rather than slid in from the side.  Basically have to tip the oven on its side to get it in the bag.  It’s frustrating to stow with just one person.  Other than that it’s good quality.
review.name: Put the zipper on top.

review.reviewBody: This is sturdy, true. BUT, the design is horrendous! The oven's handles are on the side. To get the heavy oven into the bag with the open front, it takes a lot of sliding and shoving. Why not simply put the bag opening on the top, and the oven could be lifted up, dropped in, and zipped shut? Every time I use this thing, it frustrates me more. The designer ought to be fired.
review.name: Opening should be at the top!

review.reviewBody: Difficult to put in as it is bottom load instead of top lod, Not padded at all so offering little protection from bumps and drops
review.name: Very underwellemd

review.reviewBody: Fits perfectly and holds up well.  Makes it a lot easier to remove and transport from and to the truck bed.
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody: Picked the cover up for my 10 year old stove and the fit and feature is better than the original!
review.name: Great Fit and Feature

review.reviewBody: Second time to use and can't get temp gauge to work properly
review.name: Temperatures

review.reviewBody: Bag is sturdy and protects the oven, but a little difficult to install. Almost a two person job
review.name: Would be a 5, but

name: Camp Oven Carry Bag

review.reviewBody: Bought this shell and it’s everything I wanted in a ski shell. I sized up to be able to accommodate extra layers in the chilly climates of Canada. I’m 5’9” 145 lbs and usually wear a medium but bought a large and I’m happy with it.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: I'm super impressed by the wind protection and how lightweight it is. The front zipper can be tough sometimes.
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody: I returned this item. Material was nice but i prefer material thicker and durable. My fav or goretex. I returned this because jacket fit very nicely everywhere but the waist was too tight. Im 5'-9" 170 lbs, 32 in waist so im not overweight.
review.name: Would buy again if waist was let out some.

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'10" 195lbs, standard proportions. I ordered the size Large. The waist and snow skirt fit snuggly but not too tight, however the sleeves are a little too long, the cuff Velcro is set up a little strangely, and the pass pocket likes to twist so that it's on the inside of the forearm. Otherwise it's a nice lightweight jacket perfectly at home on the skin track. Only feature that could make it better would be chest pockets large enough for climbing skins.
review.name: Lightweight, waterproof, well vented

review.reviewBody: I was impressed with the features and all the pockets on this jacket, especially when compared with higher cost options. The pass pocket on the left arm is a must have for me, and this didn't disappoint. The powder skirt is a great feature to have for those of us who don't wear bib-type pants. Recommend trying it on, as the fit is a bit longer for that ski/ride style. I'm normally a medium but got a large as I have a stockier frame and the medium was a bit tight on my shoulders/lats. No issue yet with the Pertex, and I've been impressed with how well it packs and how breathable it is compared to my Gore-Tex garments. Orange is my favorite color so I love how much orange kit OR is putting out, and the two tone breaks it up for my different toned pants. Overall have been really happy with my jacket!!
review.name: Great Feature Packed Ski Shell

review.reviewBody: The jacket is comfortable if a little baggy. It's Waterproof. The zipper is awful though. It feels cheap and sticky. Mine refuses to fully open, making the jacket a pullover at this point. I would not recommend anyone buy this jacket given the poor zipper quality.
review.name: Awful zipper ruins otherwise good jacket

review.reviewBody: Jacket has a great fit. I'm 5'11" and about 185lbs without Greasy Nachos. The jacket was purchased for backcountry and resort work, and so far I've been in the resort. One note is that it feels lightweight and so if you're looking for a thicker, bomber style finish to a jacket this is not the droid you found once-not a knock, just an observation. Go OR gear!
review.name: Purchased this jacket to replace a previous OR Jacket

review.reviewBody: Very happy with the Carbide jacket. Bought one last year and then picked up this version for the current season because I was so happy with it. The color is a shade darker IRL than is pictured on the site, a bit more on the green side than mint. Otherwise, love all the features of the jacket while staying light. Pass pocket is very clutch, hood works well without looking goofy and the plentiful pocket arrangement makes for a great jacket both inbounds and in the backcountry. Does tend to run slightly larger than other European brands like Mammut, but has a nice freeride style.
review.name: Solid jacket, now my second carbide in two seasons

review.reviewBody: This jacket is pretty sweet so far. I've skied 4 days with it so far. 2 days with it on in the resort and a few in the BC with it in the backcountry and mostly in my backpack. It's a nice feeling material the Pertex shell is nice, soft, and comfortable. I don't think it has the best DWR but the jacket stayed very dry in a light rain in British Columbia on a wet ski weekend. I thought it was going to start to wet out but it did not even if it wasn't shedding water as well as I've seen other jackets. The sleeves are long which I personally love. The hood fits like a nice three-way hood should. It's not quite a super lightweight backcountry shell with its additional arm zippers and powder skirt but it seems perfect for all-around usage in the resort and the backcountry when things are wet. As with many outdoor brand clothing, I had to size up cause the XL was super tight around my hips. The XXL is quite baggy on my chest/stomach area but this is just a classic problem with my body. I think it fits nicely for a ski jacket. With just a bit more room on the hips for the XL cause that certainly fit the rest of me a lot better. It's been a great addition to the jackets so far.
review.name: A very nice all around ski jacket

review.reviewBody: Good fit lots of adjustments but not waterproof. Skied 3 hours in the rain and the jacket got soaked through. 3 layer Gore-tex is definitely better in very rainy wet conditions. Pass sleeve pocket should face outside on the arm versus inside. Then it would be easier to position the pass for the on hill pass reader turnstyle/gate.
review.name: Ok Shell Good Price but not Waterproof.

name: Carbide Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: My 19 y/o college son, living in Montana, wanted a harness to move forward, and outside with his new hobby, rock climbing. This harness is very lightweight and my son is quite impressed with it so far. I can’t give a complete review until he gets to use it but he loves it. Other reviews stated this was a good beginner harness, the rest is to be determined.
review.name: Light weight

review.reviewBody: I'm a beginner in the outdoor climbing scene and this has been a super helpful resource to get me outside and climbing. no regrets on this purchase
review.name: does everything you want a harness to do

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable with plenty of space for equipment
review.name: Momentum Harness

review.reviewBody: Snugs up just as much as needed and very comfortable
review.name: Snugs up just as much

review.reviewBody: The right size and fit. Like the color way, and I think the overall usefulness is awesome.
review.name: Men's Momentum Harness

review.reviewBody: I actually like this harness doesn't pinch in any places good weight Loops are solid I would take a whip
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Very light weight. Super comfortable even under load. Has a very secure feeling. There are plenty of gear loops.
review.name: Momentum harness

review.reviewBody: Great harness, would definitely recommend it. I got it a bit to big for myself but that’s my fault.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody:
Very nice beginners harness. I recently started top roping and took a class using the rental harness (not sure of brand) and knew I’d need something better. I bought the Momentum harness and am thoroughly impressed. 
The adjustments for the legs are much more comfortable and easy to adjust. Belt buckle is a single strap to tighten with double D-rings so it won’t budge while climbing. Fanny adjusters are with a single pull strap from behind. 
I can hang in this and fall hard without being uncomfortable, pinched or bruised at the end of the session. 
It’s a bit of a bulky feeling harness but I believe it just adds to the support/cushion for the user and does not impede climbing. 
Highly rec this harness for beginners unsure of what to buy. Just make sure to try on the right size as the leg adjusters don’t have much adjustment. 
I’m 6’4” waist size 32 and wear a large, fits perfect.
review.name: Comfort for hours, great adjusters

review.reviewBody: Being the base level, this hardness is limited by the adjustability of the legs and waist. But it is still very comfortable and has a high-quality feel!
review.name: Great starter Harness

review.reviewBody:
Do not accidentally walk in a puddle otherwise you’ll have a squeaky shoe. 
The worst part is  my work place has all linoleum floors and I work overnight shifts.  my patients are trying to sleep and all you hear is me squeaky shoes. I’ve tried everything and still can’t get rid of it. And of course I’m out of the 30 day window. So please read the review and don’t throw $100 out the window.
review.name: I should have read the reviews!!!

review.reviewBody:
Comfortable, and an all around good runner. But if you happen to walk through lawn with morning dew, for example, expect to squeak with every step for at least the rest of the day. I would not get this shoe wet on a run. 

Disappointed that I did not buy direct from On Running - I could’ve done a warranty claim.
review.name: Don’t use near water

review.reviewBody: The cushion and midsole are super comfy, and the rocker likes to keep things moving forward. I would say that the fit is true to size, with plenty of room in the toe box for the toes to spread out a little bit. I tested this shoe out on a pretty muddy and slush covered trail (which seems about the only option currently). The lugs on the shoe aren’t super deep so, I was sliding around a decent amount. The shoe itself seemed to drain water pretty well since I didn’t notice any squishing sounds coming from each step after running through the puddles. Due to the lack of depth in the lugs, I would categorize this as mostly a door to trail shoe or light single track. Another small problem I would point out is the tongue does not come up super high compared to most other trail runners I have. While I usually don’t use the last lace hole for a lace lock system, I could see how using the upper eyelet could cause problems with the shorter tongue. Overall, I really look forward to putting more miles in this cushioned shoe once it dries out more!
review.name: Absolute cruiser on light trail.

review.reviewBody: A good running glove. Allows for much needed dexterity and warmth at the same time. The fit runs tight, so size up one size. The leather palm is great for the dog leash and appears it will last.
review.name: Good Hybrid

review.reviewBody:
I loved the Fingerless Mitts—the tight-knit quality and the added magnets were fabulous touches. However, I had to return them because the palm length was an inch too long for me. While I considered washing and shrinking them (as they’re wool), I didn’t want to risk it at this price.

For reference, I have medium-sized female hands with long fingers and ordered a small. Men with similar sizing might find them a better fit, but a women's version would have been perfect. The thumb length was perfect. 

The only other drawback was the palm patch—not actual suede, which I would expect at this price point. Otherwise, the quality and design were top-notch.
review.name: Fantastic Quality with Thoughtful Features

review.reviewBody: A winter staple. Warm and perfect when I need my fingers.
material is comfortable and thick enough for fall moose camp.  Lots of space in mid folder for heat pack
review.name: OR gloves/mits always exceed expectations

review.reviewBody: Bought these gloves last winter and have barely used them because the sizing is so weird. The fingers run way too long but the palm of the glove is too tight. I have pretty normal hands that work with most gloves. Also  the fingers in these are all cut to a similar length so your pinky lives in exile. Points for seemingly good build quality though. Just a shame about the cut/sizing.
review.name: Disappointing

review.reviewBody:
I literally thew them out after one use.
Pro: 
-they're warm and the magnetic button for the mitten is nice
Lots of cons: 
-way too bulky 
-what's the point of fingerless gloves with a fingered thumb?  they are worthless for everything you need to do with fingerless gloves, including fly fishing
-the flap constricts the fingers which minimizes warmth when it's needed most
review.name: not functional

review.reviewBody: These mitts are soooo warm. They do run bigger on the size so be prepared for that.
review.name: Great pair of gloves

review.reviewBody: effective, useful, better than anything else out there
review.name: best fingerless mitts available

review.reviewBody: They're fashionable, warm and flexible. They're my 3rd pair in the last 8 years because I wear them all the time. The thumbs tend to wear out because the material runs against the seatbelt when I'm putting it on. I need to not do that.
review.name: Soft and Warm

review.reviewBody: This glove is clearly made with such quality and beyond warm. I could see it being ideal for many winter activities. Unfortunately, for me, it is not a great fit for dog walking. The glove is so thick that I couldn’t fit it within my retractable leash handle. A real bummer, but such a great product.
review.name: Hard to Imagine Warmer

name: Lost Coast Fingerless Mitten - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Little Girls'
review.reviewBody: These are categorically not made for Canadian winters or springs. They are definitely not waterproof. At all. Not even with snow pants pulled down over them. I’m very disappointed they said waterproof and they’re absolutely not.
review.name: NOT Waterproof
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Little Girls'
review.reviewBody:
I'm happy with my Sorel boot purchase. The ease of getting these boots on and off and the quality,
comfort and warmth make these a go to wardrobe staple for my little ones closet. If it's not Sorel, I don't want it.
review.name: Love these Sorel boots

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Little Girls'
review.reviewBody: So comfortable and easy for my little one to put on!
review.name: Boot review

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Little Girls'
review.reviewBody: Bought these for my 6yo as my husband and I love and own several pairs of Sorel boots and ours work so well, but my son’s feet were soaking wet with icy water the two times he wore them out. DEFINITELY NOT WATERPROOF. Be aware.
review.name: Wet feet!
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our support team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Little Girls'
review.reviewBody: Not water repellent. Kids had their feet soaked. Better served by another boot.
review.name: Wet feet
comment: Hello Cold&Wet, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry our Children's Whitney™ II Strap Boot didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Little Girls'
review.reviewBody: My granddaughter loved her Christmas present and Mom and Dad did too!  They fit perfectly and kept her feet warm and dry in the snow!!!
review.name: Granddaughter’s Snow Boots

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Little Girls'
review.reviewBody: I live in the Midwest and wanted a brand I could trust for my 3 year old. She is OBSESSED with these boots. She can put them on herself. The straps are a little hard for her because they have to be pretty tight to get them to secure. She wears them almost every day as an everyday shoe and in the snow. So far her feet have been warm and dry. She a size 8.5 shoe but I bought a size 10. They are a little big but I’d say true to size.
review.name: Toddler is OBSESSED

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Little Girls'
review.reviewBody: I bought these boots for my 6 year old daughter. They fit perfect! True to size here. She loves the color and says they are so comfortable. She didn’t slip at all!
review.name: Great boots!

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Little Girls'
review.reviewBody: Super cute but the straps don’t hold well and come apart constantly so they come off anytime she is active… if the straps would stay on they would be perfect. Not a lot of point in a snow boot that doesn’t stay on…
review.name: Poor strap design
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our support team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Little Girls'
review.reviewBody: Especially when playing in the snow, the Velcro does not stay closed and these end up falling off my son’s feet.  Better off with a pull-on style.
review.name: Straps don’t stay closed

name: Whitney II Strap Boot - Little Girls'

review.reviewBody: Every picture and even the pictures on the box that the kit arrives in imply that one 4 oz  ISPRO MSR canister is included.  It is not.   My fault for not looking more closely, but there should be a specific statement that "ISOPRO canister is not included."
review.name: ISOPRO gas canister not included

review.reviewBody: Purchased for my SAR kit and found it ideal for this application. Lightweight, packable, reliable and fairly priced. Top notch as always, great job MSR.
review.name: Lightweight, packable and affordable.

review.reviewBody: Great light weight cook system that's uses minimal fuel to boil water and cook a quick meal.
review.name: Light weight & fuel efficient

review.reviewBody: I just finished making 15 pots of coffee on a long road trip and it worked perfectly and stowed in my kit without hardly noticing it. looking forward to more adventurous travels with it!
review.name: Great little compact stove.

review.reviewBody: Just what I needed. Fast when I need it but slow also to simmer. Great package.
review.name: Just what I needed.

review.reviewBody: Very lightweight and compact. I use it on my hiking trips and I love the fact that everything fits into the put including the fuel canister.
review.name: Very lightweight and compact. I

review.reviewBody: I love boiling water for my French press. This stove is awesome.
review.name: Great little stove

review.reviewBody:
The size, efficiency and weight of this stove is second to none.
Im a bit frustrated with myself that I didn't buy one sooner.
Highly recommend.
I have the whisperlite international as well, pocket rocket is a much better stove for backpacking and canoe camping
review.name: Best stove MSR sells

review.reviewBody:
The stove itself seems to work great. I just received it today and boiled a couple pots of water to test it out. A half liter of water went from out of the tap to a full rolling boil in about 2 1/2 minutes, and the stove wasn't even on high - the valve was open about 2/3. I dumped the water and tried it again with cold water out of the fridge. It also boiled in about 3 minutes. However I have 3 minor gripes. First, during that 2nd test the insulating ring around the top of the pot softened and slid down the pot and off the bottom, onto the flame where it caught fire. It's not a big deal because the ring is too hot to hold onto when the pot is taken off the flame anyway unless you're wearing gloves. I'll just toss the insulator and use the pot without it. Second, the handle is kind of chintzy. It's a little short to provide good leverage to grab the pot, and heats up rapidly when you do grab it. And third, while the description says the pot holds .75 liter and the bowl 16 oz, those numbers are with both containers filled right up to the brim, which would be a spillage problem. 0.5 liter and 12 oz are more realistic figures. For my use none of these are serious problems, and the stove and kit will serve their intended purpose fine for me.

Oh, and just FYI, the little Jetboil orange plastic fuel canister stabilizer, doesn't fit. At least not with the canisters I bought (Coleman 8 oz). If you want a stabilizer, it's probably better to get the more expensive MSR adjustable one.
review.name: Good stove, kit is a little lacking

review.reviewBody: Good little stove. I burnt the plastic bowl that comes with the kit. Can i get a replacement?
review.name: gtreat stove

name: PocketRocket 2 Mini Stove Kit

review.itemreviewed: Knit Insulated Logo Graphic Cuffed Beanie
review.reviewBody: Real thick Carhartt true to its product well made and keeps my bald head warm during there cold times
review.name: Oh YEAH!!!

review.itemreviewed: Knit Insulated Logo Graphic Cuffed Beanie
review.reviewBody: 15 out of 10 stars! Love this hat for doing anything outside in the colder months. Definitely will be adding more to my Carhartt collection.

review.itemreviewed: Knit Insulated Logo Graphic Cuffed Beanie
review.reviewBody: Got this at a Diprimas Shoe Store and a week later got a hole on top and also the material on inside of beanie started lumping up and balling up on inside. Feels weird. All my other Carhartt beanies like the acrylic watch never had issues even washing or drying them the other beanies never did that or ruin.
review.name: Sucks

review.itemreviewed: Knit Insulated Logo Graphic Cuffed Beanie
review.reviewBody: My grandson likes it. He put it on right away on Christmas Day

review.itemreviewed: Knit Insulated Logo Graphic Cuffed Beanie
review.reviewBody: Fits so awkward, such a weird shape it creates. Looks terrible on. It's built too long and the material is to think that it just doesn't look right. I would return if I could. Just get the regular knit cuff.
review.name: Major Dislike

review.itemreviewed: Knit Insulated Logo Graphic Cuffed Beanie
review.reviewBody:
Very good quality and fits very well!
I would by this item again
review.name: Good Quality

review.itemreviewed: Knit Insulated Logo Graphic Cuffed Beanie
review.reviewBody: Love love so warm!!!
review.name: Carhartt beanie

review.itemreviewed: Knit Insulated Logo Graphic Cuffed Beanie
review.reviewBody: It's very well made. Too tight though. Had to give it to my wife.
review.name: Nice but small

review.itemreviewed: Knit Insulated Logo Graphic Cuffed Beanie
review.reviewBody: Great hat all the way around. Worn Carhartt for over 45 years and the quality speaks for itself.

review.itemreviewed: Knit Insulated Logo Graphic Cuffed Beanie
review.reviewBody: Most of the hats I bought  before did not fit well. These are great size. I got them  as a present  for my Husband.  I just love the way they fit. The colors are a plus too.
review.name: Hats the right size

description: Buy the Sunday Afternoons Dreamer Hat online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Dreamer Hat
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sunday Afternoons Dreamer Hat online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a gift for my sister who had just had skin cancers removed.  She loved it and it looks great!
review.name: Purchased as a gift

review.reviewBody: I wanted something more stylish when seeking this hat and love the color choices. I also need a hat that doesn't have the brim flap up (as I walk much less in wind).  I spent an afternoon (decent wind for kites and for me to notice) on Lake Michigan yesterday, and the brim didn't flap!
review.name: So far so good!

review.reviewBody: Not an everyday, all day hat. A bit hot and heavy, but nice looking. More of a show hat.
review.name: Its not an active persons hat.

review.reviewBody: Great material, very thin wire around rim. Wish there was size small
review.name: Material and sizing

review.reviewBody: Very well made. Quality materials. This is my second hat from Sunday Afternoons. The only issue I have with this one is the brim stays straight out. I know there is wire at the edge but I can get it to stay in the shape I want.
review.name: Comfortable flexible hat.

review.reviewBody: Great hat... all my Sunday Afternoon hats are great!... soft lanyard and stays put!!
review.name: Newest addition

review.reviewBody: I like the style, which is a bit nicer looking than a normal safari hat, but still has a string to keep it on my head in the wind and good sun protection. The lining in the crown though makes it a bit hot because it isn't breathable
review.name: Nice looking sun protection

review.reviewBody: I love this hat! It’s really perfect for dressing down or up and its well made. My only hesitation is that it might not last forever before the hat looks a little worn and not as nice - the material it’s made out of doesn’t seem super durable.
review.name: Great hat!

review.reviewBody: This hat exceeded my expectations! Super cute and fits so well. Great coverage and bead doesn’t slip on the strap so it stays secure in the wind. I have four other hats from this company for my kids and husband that we love and I researched for so long to find the perfect hat for myself. I was hesitant at first because it was new and had no reviews (I’m that person who reads every single review before making a purchase LOL), and I don’t like spending money on myself, but I took a leap and this hat is worth every single penny. 10/10 recommend!
review.name: 10/10 Recommend!!!

name: Dreamer Hat

description: Buy the Fjallraven Abisko Sun Hoodie - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Abisko Sun Hoodie - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Abisko Sun Hoodie - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I bought a  few months ago and I am generally happy with the top however, the odours build up very quickly, after a single day use, compared to other base layer tops I have which is a challenge on multi day hikes.
Perhaps this can be addressed in future models.
review.name: Good, but odours build up quickly

review.reviewBody: I bought this a few months ago and the quality is what I would expect from Fjallraven, but it has failed to protect me from the sun if I am outside all day in the sun. I am quite pale which is why I purchased this and if you're going to wear a sun hoodie, you'd expect some protection from UV rays at least. I like the shirt & I'll continue to wear it on days where I need minor sun protection, but I'll use a different product on when I will 100% need UV protection.
review.name: Nice shirt but no UV protection

review.reviewBody: The best workout/active long sleeve hoodie. Perfect roomie fit.
review.name: The best

review.reviewBody: Been using for biking and running; it's been great
review.name: Solid sun hoodie

review.reviewBody:
lite and fast drying, good protection under sun from head to wrist, i wear it everytime i go hiking or camping, just picked up second one today..
wish there was more choice for colour
review.name: love it!

review.reviewBody:
Excellent quality, XL fits me perfectly, I am 6'0" 190 lbs. Super comfortable and perfect when a heavier weight hoodie might get too warm. 

Breathes well, I wear this trail hiking in cooler mornings in Arizona. I really like the hood, I pull it up over my cap to protect my neck from the sun, and unlike other, fruit flavored hoodies I have, it is roomie enough not to be constricting, and the geometry is perfect to stay up without blowing down.

I wish it was available in black and some lighter colors.
review.name: Comfortable, medium weight hoodie

review.reviewBody: Super breathable, fast drying. Everything you can want in a shirt for hikes in the scorching sun. Great protection yet leaves you feeling cool and airy. Great cut too. If you don’t have one, I highly recommend.
review.name: Perfect shirt for mid summer hikes

review.reviewBody: The quintessential shirt for hot, exposed hikes in the Grand Canyon! Kept me quite cool in 106 degree heat with it’s excellent ventilation and windsock like quality vectoring any light breeze around my face, head, neck and upper back. So well made!
review.name: Grand Canyon R2R2R

review.reviewBody: I’ve used this shirt for countless fishing trips and about 2,800 miles of backpacking. The fit is non-constricting and the material is super breathable. I really like the size of the hood and the fact that it covers your neck. If you wear it  with a brimmed hat the hood protects your peripheral from sun as well. After thru hiking the Continental Divide Trail wearing this as my everyday shirt with a backpack on it showed very little wear. Great shirt!
review.name: Amazing sun shirt!

review.reviewBody: This is my favourite Base layer hoodie for day to day and backpacking. There is a nice wide brim on it to shade your face. The fit is relaxed so it never feels uncomfortable. The sleeves are long enough to cover your hands to keep them shaded. The fabric is crazy breathable and dries super fast. The hoody is a bit heavy at 170grams but not having to use a stupid ball cap on my head more than makes up for that.
review.name: Amazing Sun Protection and breathability - No need for a ball cap ever again !!!

name: Abisko Sun Hoodie - Men's

review.reviewBody: Since purchasing my first pair of these a year ago, ive not worn any other non-suit pants. Comfortable and cut for movement, ive worn them for everything from business casual, to backpacking, and bouldering.
review.name: The most comfortable pants ever

review.reviewBody: I have these pants for less than a week. Ended up having to bushwack for about a mile. Ended up tearing in 4 separate places!
review.name: Did not last one bushwhack

review.reviewBody: I've worn these pants a handful of times and the hem on the right leg is coming undone and the snap on the waistband doesn't stay snapped well.
review.name: Renegade Pant

review.reviewBody: These hiking pants have been changed and do not fit like last years design. No adjustable closure at the feet, Velcro at the rear pockets instead of a zipper, considerably larger at the foot. I tried them on and immediately returned them.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: The fabric and Klassik fit make this pant very comfortable. It will withstand many bushwhacking’s. The DWR treatment works exceptionally well. I purchased a 34x 32 pant and after buying one I immediately purchased another because of the quality. I highly recommend this pant.
review.name: Renegade pant

review.reviewBody: Very nice fit and finish-not too tight or too loose. Excellent array of pockets with good depth and some with zips and others with velcro. Material feels like it will withstand some tough use not like some of the thinner ones I have had in the past. Much better than other brand I have tried.
review.name: Excellent hiking pants

review.reviewBody: Breathable, fairly stretchy, great protection. I hike in So Cal in the heat but prefer to have pants vs shorts, these retain very little heat (especially when paired with exofficio boxers) and give great protection.
review.name: Great hiking pants

review.reviewBody:
Picked these up to wear on day hikes. Great pair of pant, move well and have ample pockets.
The fabric has just enough stretch to allow the pants to move well. Very comfortable and breathable pants.
review.name: Great pair of pant

review.reviewBody: These pants are great!  To nit-pick I wish there was a larger or second zippered pocket, but great pants!
review.name: Great!

name: Renegade Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great glove, small enough to pack as a spare pair durable enough for scrambling and winter climbing
review.name: Great glove, small enough to

review.reviewBody:
Despite measuring them very carefully on your size chart the gloves were at least 1cm short in all the fingers. 
I looked at them carefully with view to getting a larger size but the quality of the leather, I felt, was poor. 
Not impressed by your sizing instructions 
Sent back and didn’t reorder
review.name: Despite measuring them very carefully

review.reviewBody: Great for bike riding as the pre curved fingers aid in keeping a firm relaxed grip on the bars. Very comfortable and it takes a lot of rain before they start to feel damp.
review.name: Great for bike riding as

review.reviewBody: Been waking in -3 and my fingers are about to drop off.
review.name: Been waking in -3 and

review.reviewBody:
Used for first time ice climbing on Ben Nevis - great fit and feel when on steep ice, rope and gear handling really good - a top glove

Not the warmest when wet but wouldn't expect them to be
review.name: a great glove

review.reviewBody: Super glove - only tried dry tooling due to movement restrictions. Went for a size medium fits fingers on back of the hand 1 cm up from joint on the inside but am guessing this will stretch with time. Super dexterity for ice tools and gear will probably go up a model and size for thicker warmer sets for Scotland
review.name: Super glove - only tried

review.reviewBody: Nice dexterity, not too warm and very breathable. Pretty much exactly what I was looking for. Used on a cool 18° F morning with a stiff breeze and my hands were not cold but also not sweaty. Wanted a glove for Fall/early winter/spring SAR work. These look like they will be perfect. Can't wait to try them ice climbing
review.name: Nice dexterity, not too warm

name: Axis Glove

description: Buy the Eureka! NoBugZone Screenhouse online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: NoBugZone Screenhouse
hasVariant.description: Buy the Eureka! NoBugZone Screenhouse online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Did what it was meant to do, keep bugs out, especially near the picnic table
Bought this for the kids first yard camp out - success!
review.name: Kids party house

review.reviewBody: My husband are in our 50’s & new to camping. We pop this shelter up and down very quickly. We had rain on our last camping trip & this withstood the downpour. We took it apart soaking wet & put it together at our next stop with just a little bit more effort.
review.name: Goes up easy, comes down easy, and holds up well.

review.reviewBody: Good for what I bought it for - short campground trips.  Already own 12x12 Northern Breeze for longer trips and backcountry use.  Upright sides help keep out rain, long enough to go over picnic table, and wide enough to move around a bit.  Replace steel poles with aluminum and it gets a 5.
review.name: Good campground option

review.reviewBody: We have several Eureka style tents and have loved them all.
review.name: Great no bug tent

review.reviewBody: We purchased this after seeing a few people post about it online, and had high hopes. Unfortunately the second time we assembled it one of the poles bent. Also in general the screen house is just not very sturdy. They post a video online of setting it up without the rainfly and using no guylines, and we can't imagine how it would say up that way even staked down at the corners. If you slightly touch a pole the whole screenhouse will lean. Pros would be the bag to store it in. Plenty of room for getting everything packed back up and its the perfect size.
review.name: Underwhelmed
comment: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. Your feed back is very much appreciated. We would like the opportunity to speak with you to assist you further on your concerns. Please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday as we would like for you to be able to enjoy your new tent.

review.reviewBody: My friends are sick of hearing me talk about how much I love my new screen tent, so I'll have to tell you...I LOVE IT! It's as though I've added a room to my house. I was getting eaten alive with bugs before, so I was never outdoors after late afternoon. Now, I eat dinner out there, work on my laptop out there, I've even slept outdoors. Wonderful addition to my life during COVID. Simple design, does just what you need it to.
review.name: Very excellent purchase!

review.reviewBody: I bought this for shade--rain shelter--bug shelter and I like it well enough. It wasn't super simple to set up alone, but I was able to manage it. I'm 5'6" and had to stand on the picnic table for the last bits of assembly and to start the disassembly, but it worked OK. I like the tent, but one critique is to make it easier to figure out the front from the back before it's full assembled. I thought I had it figured out but I didn't. Other than that, no major complaints. There were some wind gusts and I was a little worried about it blowing away because I didn't have a mallet to really hammer the stakes down, but it was ok, and I promptly ordered a mallet when I got home. Overall, I don't hesitate recommending this and foresee it getting a lot of use.
review.name: Able to set up solo

review.reviewBody: We just bought a new pop-up camper and purchased this screen house to accompany it.  We enjoy camping in the north woods and insects can be horrible there.  We had our first trial run this week and the screen house worked out well for us.  We set it up, then pulled it over our picnic table and we were able to dine without buggy problems. Pretty easy to set up, but I have a lot of trouble detaching the straight poles when it is take-down time.  I just don't seem to have tough enough fingers to press down the wire clasp that attaches them.  Maybe they will become more flexible with use.
review.name: Just what we needed

review.reviewBody: Not happy. Pole bent third ttime used from mild wind.
review.name: No Bug Zone
comment: Thank you for reaching out. I am truly sorry for our delay in response and for the issue that you have experienced with your pole. If you have not already, please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday as we want you to enjoy your new tent.

name: NoBugZone Screenhouse

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Savu 2L Hydration Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Savu 2L Hydration Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Savu 2L Hydration Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently purchased both the Savu 2 and the Savu 5 waist packs (the 2 for my wife and the 5 for me).

We are long-time recreational mountain bike/trail riders and desired waist packs to carry our water bottles, a few snacks, small first aid goods, tire levers, tire patch kit, a small multi tool, cell phones, and a small electric tire pump with a bit of room to spare.

I did a lot of internet searching looking at reviews of waist packs and decided on Osprey. I found that these two products are very well made and offered at a very fair and reasonable price.

Both packs are easy to wear and I like the detailed construction of the sides and back of the pack that vents sweat and heat from the body, especially in the hot Arkansas summers where we live and ride (yes, these packs work well).


And during the winter months on the days when it is too cold to ride our bikes, we will wear them on our day hikes as well. :-)
review.name: I recently purchased both the

review.reviewBody: The Savu 2 is a great pack for biking and hiking because it is unobtrusive and carries just the essentials without bogging you down. It was my daily driver on a 5 day gravel bike trip through the Dolomites and stayed in place without fail on some big and fast descents with rough and loose terrain.
review.name: Excellent small pack for those who want to carry an extra bottle

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've been using the Seral 7 for over 3 years and loving it but wanted to try out a bottle only set up. It has been an incredible change. Not needing to fill and empty a bladder for each ride is just one more obstacle to drop to help me get out on the trial. I even plan to buy the Savu 5 to add a 2nd extra bottle for slightly longer or hotter rides. I was particularly happy that I could still fit a small Lezyne hand pump going between both chambers of the Savu 2. It has almost all of the storage I could ask for with a hip pack, small front strap pouches big enough to hold a multitool on one side and an energy bar on the other would make this pack perfect.
review.name: I've been using the Seral

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So far, this is the best hip pack I have found. My only complaint is that it is a little tougher than anticipated to remove/replace the water bottle while riding.
review.name: So far, this is the

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good for small hand pump, snacks, spare tube. holds water bottle snug. hip location allows for great freedom while riding single track. Comfortable trap. This is my daily all-around pack!
review.name: Good for small hand pump,

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my son to use and finally got good enough weather that we got to use it. Works well to fit his gear and water for our typical shorter rides. Highly recommend.
review.name: Nice Hip Pack

review.reviewBody: I wear my Savu 2 on my everyday dawn patrol bike rides. It carries my essentials cleanly, comfortably, and securely.
review.name: Love my Savu 2

review.reviewBody: Such a good pack. Comparable to the bontrager rapid pack, but more rigid. This lets you one hand and take the bottle out drink and return it while pedaling easy road and single track. Can carry a decent amount of water with a bottle on the frame and you can carry a larger bottle such as the soma further bottle in the hip pack giving an extra 1 L there. Getting items in can be a bit awkward and space limited but I can fit a tube and some repair items in it plus some first aid kit. Then keep pump and one up edc on the bike. Good pack to help get my rides in the 15 to 20 mile range on my local AZ trails.
review.name: My perfect hip pack

review.reviewBody: I wanted something to carry water, snacks, and tools on medium length bike rides (to replace using a hydration backpack). The SAVU 2 design seemed to be what I needed, but the waist belt wouldn't remain tight. The belt loosens because the plastic cinch buckles allow it to slip. I had to stop every few minutes to cinch the belt tight again. It became a danger on the bike as the loosened belt allowed the pack to get hooked on my saddle. I may hike with it, but I definitely won't use it cycling.
review.name: SAVU 2 Fails Due to Waist Belt Design

name: Savu 2L Hydration Pack

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately, the right shoe is smaller than the left shoe. The left fits perfectly but they are different in size. I need to return them.
review.name: I wish it fits!

review.reviewBody:
Something has happened to the X Ultra shoes! I have worn a version of X ultra for more than a decade. They have been my favorite hiking shoes! So I ordered this one. It was very wide. So wide in fact, that I thought I had inadvertently  ordered a wide size. I returned it and then went to a local retail store wearing my four year old X Ultra shoes. The store which has a huge selection of hiking shoes,  carries exactly two Salomon hiking shoes for women.  I tried on another X ultra style. I had to go down two shoe sizes from my regular size and they were still too big. The toe box is huge! My heel slipped out of the shoe despite wearing thick socks. I do not have a narrow foot. 

 I am so disappointed. I had no choice but to change brands after years and years of loyalty. 
There are dozens of trail running shoes to choose from, but only a few true women's low hiking shoes. I hope this will change and you will go back to the fit I have known and trusted for the last 5 hiking shoe purchases.
review.name: I wanted to like this shoe.
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: I wore it once lightly and the laces tore. Other than that it was good
review.name: Weak
comment: Hi. We’re sorry for any inconvenience. We’re glad to confirm that a case has been opened to address your concerns, and we’re waiting for your answer. Please check your inbox!

review.reviewBody: I loved these shoes and have worn them for hiking here in CO almost every day since I bought them at the end of May.  Unfortunately, one of the lace holds has already ripped open - no way to fix or use anymore.  I am very disappointed.
review.name: Could have been Great

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes! I live in Colorado and hike a lot. I started with a couple neighborhood walks with my dog and then jumped right to a harder 7 mile hike. Was hoping I wouldn’t regret that with new shoes but worked out great! Made me wish I would have traded in my old ones sooner.
review.name: love!

review.reviewBody: I am an elementary school art teacher and am on my feet for several hours a day walking around my classroom. These sneakers provide great support and comfort for my feet. This is my second pair of Salomon's and they don't disappoint. The bungee lace is quick and convenient for when I want to take them off quick at the end of the day. I recommend sizing up half a size. I am an 8 in most shoes, but wear an 8.5 in Salomon's.
review.name: Amazing Sneakers!

review.reviewBody: I love this shoes! Wore them to hike Mt Elbert in Colorado which is over 14k feet high. It took me around 6 hours to climb up the mountain and around 4 hours to climb down. The weather was cold, around 30F and my feet remained warm and dry even after stepping on water at the beginning of our hike. They have great grip. No break-in period was necessary in my case. I had only wore this shoes for a small hike in the Italian Dolomites before hiking Mt Elbert. My husband has the male version of this shoe and he also loves how comfortable they’re.
review.name: Great hiking shoes

review.reviewBody:
I bought these hikers as a replacement for my previous pair which I totally wore out.
They are super comfortable and have a good grippy tread.  would definitely recommend.
review.name: Perfect fit

review.reviewBody: My ideal shoe has a roomy toe box and a snug heel with good arch support, and this shoe is perfect.  It has also has excellent cushioning, and the first time I put them on I could wear them for hours.  My only request would be for more colors, particularly in darker, more neutral shades.
review.name: A super comfortable shoe

review.reviewBody: My husband has had these shoes for a year and was very impressed so I got some. They are waterproof, comfortable and I love the colour. I wear them for dog walking.
review.name: Love these shoes

name: X Ultra 360 CSWP Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I will caveat that I haven't had the opportunity to wear these in frigid temps (15F or lower) but they've been fantastic so far. 6 days ain't much, but the fit is darn near perfect and I'm very happy with the pockets and venting. The face fabric feels durable but like a hybrid between soft shell and hard, and breaths wonderfully.
review.name: Light but versatile

review.reviewBody: im 5'11'' 180 lbs and purchased the large. they fit well but would like more room in the hips. Tons of pockets and zippers for ventilation. I'm in the north east and its been cold. I layer two pair of longjons when its cold and the are perfect. so far i love them.
review.name: excellent bibs so far.

review.reviewBody:
Pluses:
1. Material is great, both breathable and reasonably waterproof. 
2. Fit is generous which is good for a lightly insulated bibs, you can fit layers underneath.
3. Hatch is great, bibs without rear hatch should not exist at all. For the same reason 2-sided fly is great, toilet breaks while wearing a harness are a breeze.
4. Pockets are nicely placed and well thought-out.

Minuses:
1. Main gripe is that size in the size table is completely off. I'm 180 cm tall, weigh 80 kg, not too athletic, not too fat either. Size L - which I ordered as I'm somewhat between sizes to make sure I fit insulation underneath - looks like a joke on me, with bib coming up to the nose and lower pants dragging on the floor. Also, the strange cut of the back with excess material (which can be seen in the product photos above! as though they consider that to be a feature, not a bug) is a problem in itself, but when the size is so much larger than needed, it's just ridiculous. 
2. Since there is no need for a belt, there are no belt loops, but they didn't add loops for hanging stuff on the pants. Admittedly, not all pants have them, but they are great (but for a membrane garment, you can't just quickly sow them on yourself). So they should have added a few gear loops above the pockets.

Bottomline - great material, OK functionality, strange cut and inadequate sizing guide.
review.name: Size not per size guide, otherwise ok

review.reviewBody: Bibs are awesome! A little tight around the top of the hips but otherwise very comfortably fitting.
review.name: Works great!

review.reviewBody: love the fit of these. they're not super baggy, nor tight. there's also a bit of stretch which is super nice to have! Pocket setup is fantastic and makes access convenient. really like the power strap slots which makes it easier toto access the walk lever on my boots.
review.name: great bibs!

review.reviewBody: Have been touring with these in the spring conditions they breath well and shed water very well.
review.name: Great fit, Lightweight and great for Alaskan Backcountry

review.reviewBody: I purchased this as my first pair of bibs mostly because of the dedicated beacon pocket. The thin and stretchy nature gets me pumped for summer and future skiing. I am excited to not feel like I am wearing a plastic bag on my legs for future ski trips.
review.name: First pair of bibs

review.reviewBody: Nice ski bibs, just having a small issue with the snow cuff. It's really hard to stretch it around my ski boot.
review.name: Nice ski bibs

review.reviewBody: I've use these bibs throughout the winter for ski touring and they have worked great. They are super breathable compared to other bibs I have used, which is the best feature for me as I run pretty hot. I also like the chest zip as it can be unzipped to dump extra heat and provide better airflow. Pocket placement is also great and I really like the chest beacon pocket. They do get a little cold if you are using them for lift accessed skiing but I don't think that is their intended use. Overall 5/5 great bibs.
review.name: Great Shell for Ski Touring

review.reviewBody: It fits me really well. I got a medium I’m 6ft 165 pounds. The back where the straps are looks a little weird cause it has extra material but to me that doesn’t matter. Very good waterproofing, it’s stretchy and gaiters are the legs are tight so it keeps everything out.
review.name: Excellent Shell

name: Skytour AscentShell Bib Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I am really disappointed that they eliminated (or didn't design for) a chest or inner pocket that older models have in the outer shell. It's too late to return this, but I will give it away.
review.name: Not quite up to an old triclimate.

review.reviewBody: This coat strikes a wonderful balance between lightness and warmth.
review.name: Great coat

review.reviewBody: Brand new jacket and it is always SOAKED when raining. The pocket zipper also came off maybe in a week. Genuinely today, while out walking in waste high grass in the rain. The jacket was far more soaked than my jeans.
review.name: Wetter than jeans

review.reviewBody: Last one with the good normal size zipper. However look close, simple cuffs, only 2 pockets, very thin water proof material. Inner coat is nice. 1st North Face Coat Zipper 11 years. 2nd coat with new style zipper, 1 year. 3rd coat still available with old style zipper 1 year. 4th coat is this one with old style zipper, we'll see. However most people would learn their lesson by now.
review.name: Great for a light rain jacket or mild spring/fall.

review.reviewBody: Excellent for rain protection. Zip in liner allows for one jacket to cover a large range of temperatures.
review.name: Excellent multi use jacket.

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my husband. He's never had a North Face jacket and I still have one from almost 20 years ago that's in great condition. He loves it. The color is perfect. Goes with everything. He looks so good in it.
review.name: My Husband Loves His First North Face!

review.reviewBody: Haven't had the chance to use this yet. I bought it for my 2026 trip to Europe. I'm sure it is going to work well because when I tried it on at the store I was already sweating after a couple of minutes. I bought because I like the style and how the inside fleece liner can be removed and for the color of the jacket.
review.name: Warm and versitle jacket

review.reviewBody: Great fit and look! So warm and comfy, love the color as well.
review.name: Love this warm jacket

review.reviewBody: Perfect for my 15 yr old. Thin enough to fit in his back pack at school, warm enough to wear outside while waiting for the bus and waterproof enough for the rainy days.
review.name: I would buy again

review.reviewBody: Multifunctional high quality and waterproof jacket.
review.name: Wonderful jacket

review.reviewBody: Sent back. Still waiting for refund
review.name: Well made. Didnt fit

review.reviewBody: These pants are awesome. Great baggier fit for people with larger muscular legs. I’m 6’2 or 188cm and I got a L regular. Slightly long but nothing a belt can’t help. I took them on a mountaineering adventure snowshoeing through knee to waist deep snow without getting even a drop wet. Incredible breathability, stretch, and comfort. I love the color too! They even ripped because I snagged them with a crampon and still didn’t let any water through!
review.name: Best Mountain Soft Shell Pant

review.reviewBody: Very warm, quick drying as I live in a rain forest. I've had a pair for over a year and loved them so much I needed a second pair as I mostly live in them through fall, winter and spring. No damage or ware for over a year
review.name: Definitely worth it

review.reviewBody: Wore while snowshoeing in cold conditions. They worked well with equipment and kept dry and warm
review.name: Warm and comfortable

review.reviewBody:
One of the best mountaineering pants you can get - durable, breathable, and yet still warm at any altitude. These are my go-to pants for many PNW mountain treks (Mt Adams, Middle Sister, Mt. Hood, etc). 

The fit is fairly true-to-size, but I would have expected a bit more stretch in the waist. I'm usually a 32 in most clothing, and M's feel a bit tight. There's plenty of stretch in the legs which makes for easily climbing, but the waist can definitely be a bit annoying. It's not enough to take away from how great these are, but something to consider if you're on the border of sizes.
Pants look good, durable and fit awesome. Great for hiking, skiing, even just walking around
review.name: Great pants

review.reviewBody: Got these to start mountaineering. Definitely good designs and well-thought out for such activies. Comfy over long hours, fits well and good enough to stop wind and allow breathability.
review.name: Great Pants!

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite winter pants I have owned 3 pairs... My only complaint is zipper quality 2/3 have had pocket zippers fail so far...
review.name: Great pants poor quality zippers

review.reviewBody: As a woman that has to purchase mens gear for sizing, these will be great for this winter. I find it hard to shop womens gear, as they don't fit in the hips. Not all adventurous women are a size 6.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Used these pants on a remote winter bike touring trip. I was so happy with how these performed. They went through a month of daily use and held up incredibly well and provided me with the protection I needed. My only complaint would be that they fit long (although this worked out to my advantage on the bike) and I have long legs (so for regular activities they will drag a bit). I used them with the OR suspenders.
review.name: Very impressive

name: Cirque II Softshell Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: This became my go-to, everyday ski jacket last season. It’s comfortable, stylish, and lightweight yet warm. I haven’t tested it in sub 25 degrees, so I don’t know how warm it would keep me considering layers… right now I do a light sweatshirt underneath and it’s perfect!
review.name: Love this jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have used my new jacket once for resort skiing so far. I love the soft material and fun colors. Others complained about the wide neck on the jacket but I wore mine with a balaclava and had the hood up all day due to wind and it was fine. It fit comfortably over a helmet.  I am 5'10" (125lbs) size small with very long arms and have really struggled to find a jacket that works for me. It seems true to size. I often size up to medium due to my height but the small looks great on me. Medium would have given me more room to layer but would have looked baggy I think. I wore a base layer and fleece underneath and stayed warm. The arms are long but I still wish they were just a touch longer (or at least the sleeve liner with a thumb hole). I can't comfortably wear my thumb in the thumb hole but this won't be a problem for most women! Love the jacket and I'm happy with it so far!
review.name: Great jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am 5'9" and 140 pounds with a long torso. This fits perfectly around my chest and to hips. I love the pink and buff color
review.name: Great fit

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Jacket  - Women's
Last Chair Stretch Insulated Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was convinced this coat wouldn't work for me because most coats don't! I'm 5'11.5" and typically a size 8-10, so usually a medium, but I struggle with finding coats/shirts/jackets that accommodate my upper body. With a larger bust, wide lats, and some decent shoulders, most coats are tight and restrict movement. This one... fits. It fits WELL. The stretch is a bonus, but just by the cut alone, I have freedom of movement and room for a baselayer or two. It looks fitted but not tight. I'm ... shocked. (The matching pants were too small in a medium, but we're trying a large.)
review.name: This coat surprised me!

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love it. It's so cozy with its fleecy lining and warm. On 25 degree days I just wore my thin base layer underneath. Great length and powder skirt. People reviewed that the neck hole is too big. I like it because I can get my chin in there on cold runs down the hill. I don't find it too big at all. The pockets are great. The thumb holes at the cuffs are super nice.
review.name: Great jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this insulated jacket. Ive never had problems with it on the mountain. It is waterproof and warm. I ordered a sized medium so I could have a little extra room to put a mid layer under it if needed. I almost never need to though because this jacket keeps me pretty warm. The fit and comfort is great. The hood is big and fits over a helmet. A true 5 star jacket!
review.name: My New Favorite Snowboard Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the look, feel and weight of this jacket and was so excited to get it. It is my favorite colors, I got the green/blue color pattern. I haven't gotten a new ski jacket in 20 years!!  I am so so very sad that I have to return it because the hood only adjust at the back of the head for a ski helmet and not at the neck area. The jacket is very big and baggy at the neck, which would be fine if adjustable. There is no way to adjust it at the neck and when zipped all the way up it hangs forward very far. I know if it is not a very warm ski day I would have so much air coming in I would be freezing, much less the very cold snowy days. I need a jacket that can cinch up tight around my whole head to keep the wind out. I have found another jacket that does this, as many do. Sadly this jacket is not good for skiing, snowboarding etc due to the non adjust at the neck area.
review.name: Neck too big and not adjustable :)

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: I own the Cottonwoods kit which I absolutely love but I was looking for an insulated kit for this year and absolutely hit the jackpot with this. The material is incredibly soft and perfectly insulating, I can't wait to wear it all season!
review.name: SO COMFY

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: Do not order from Backcountry. I ordered this jacket, along with three others to try on for the upcoming season. My package was never delivered and I've been disputing the $1,434 charge with Backcountry for 4 weeks now. I've spoken to 5 different representatives. They said it is above the threshold of paying me back, so now I'm in the middle of disputing it with my credit card. Backcountry is not worth the hassle, you are better off ordering from a different company.
review.name: Do Not Order This Jacket

name: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Jacket  - Women's

review.reviewBody: The jersey is great. The only negative is I feel the pockets in the back are too big. I suggest keeping your phone in a pocket on your bibs or saddle bag.
review.name: Great Fit

review.reviewBody: This was the most expensive jersey I have ever purchased and overall I am not very pleased.   The aesthetics and the fit of this jersey are both good; however, there is one major flaw.  Unlike every other jersey I own, this jersey does not have the rubber grip waistband.  This grip around the waist is critical because, without it, the jersey pockets bounce and sag when loaded.  This issue is made worse because the material is very stretchy and the fit is somewhat looser than others I have worn.  This is seriously annoying.  Even the cheapest jerseys I have purchased in the past ($30 and up) have had this band so it is laughable that they wouldn't have one on a jersey that costs $100+.  I am returning for this reason.
review.name: Not Good

review.reviewBody: I bought this boot two weeks ago , and I would have to say one of the best boots I have ever worn! Merrell has a new customer for life. The boot is ultra lightweight , it’s very warm and insulated to keep your feet cozy. It’s super comfortable and flexible and also water proof. review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots definitely do the trick. I have taken them in sub zero temps, waded through snow, and walked through rivers. So far my feet have stayed dry, warm and toasty. I would highly recommend these boots.

comment: Thank you for the excellent feedback!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Well thought out boot.  Comfortable right out of the box.  Definitely waterproof. Soles have good grip on our wet snow.  Like the new design of the top two eyelets.  Big improvement over the ‘bent’ metal ones. Am not sure about the flat laces and how long they will last. Also the location of the gattor ring is troubling.  Not sure mine will stretch that distance. Have worn boots 15 times and have about 75 to 100 miles on them.
review.name: HOT NEW MOAB 2 SPEED BOOTS

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've been trying to get good "intermediate" boots for mixed terrain (snow, packed snow,  ice, mud,  rocks,  etc.) For about a year now.  I bought several pairs and returned them all. I bought these and they are exactly what I was looking for.  They are perfect for what I do.  They are waterproof, warm,  and rugged. I will be purchasing more pairs.
review.name: Outstanding boots!
comment: Thank you for your awesome feedback!
