review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: I was optimistic about the update to this bag, but it fell short. The bag was well constructed, but the two main issues with the bag were, shoulder width and temp rating. I was looking for a bag that could handle between 20-30F. Camping with a low of 32F, the bag did not keep me warm and I tend to sleep warm. I am average size and the bag tightly locks in on my shoulders. I am returning the bag.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: Got this new sleeping bag in and it was warm and roomy. I'm 6ft tall and got the regular size bag and there is room for me. Didn't feel the need to get the long version. Zipper is pretty smooth. Still getting used to the draw stings on the hood, struggling a little to tighten and loosen the hood while the bag is zipped all the way up and I'm in it. But I'll figure it out. For the money, you cant get better than this bag. It came in around 2.6/2.7 lbs.

review.reviewBody: Most comfortable saddle for me after trying many others, however, they're certainly overpriced. Furthermore, the raised stitched lettering all over the saddle is quite annoying, both aesthetically and functionally. It could increase friction where you don't want it. Totally unnecessary to have so much advertising all over the saddle. There's even a reflective plastic piece at the back of the saddle with Selle prominently displayed. Finally, the leather is a bit thin and fragile, showing significant wear after 1 year.
review.name: Good comfort, annoying product labeling

review.reviewBody:
I've been an avid SMP saddle user for quite some time. I find them to be the most comfortable saddles I have used to date.   In the SMP line up I can ride a couple of the saddles and depending on the bike is how I choose which one.  
Century rides or Trainer = SMP Stratos 
 Fat Bike = Stratos  
Enduro bike = Drakon  
Road Bike for crits = Drakon   

Now just recently I have been riding the Blaster and really love it, I feel that will be my new saddle for the road bike. The reason I have the Drakon as I wanted a saddle that would allow me to slide up a bit when going on break aways or get over the cranks a little more prepping for that big sprint and the Stratos was not allowing me to do that like I wanted. Now that I have the Blaster I feel that will be the new road saddle and even take over for the mountain bike as well.  

For Reference  Cat 2 Road  5'9" 32" inseam  34" waist 175lbs
review.name: SMP for the win

name: Stratos Saddle

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased this Omni gaiter neck for myself because I spend a lot of time outside in the winter doing maintenance for a school. I need something that protects my face from the outside elements and also helps protect my lungs due to asthma. I used my husbands fleece no brand gaiter and didn’t have the issues of it getting wet due to collecting moisture from my breath. However, the size didn’t work for me and that is why I purchased this product.  I was so excited to receive this because I love Columbia products. I have Columbia boots, shoes, fleece jackets, snow pants, and a nice jacket. 
The Gaiter feels and looks soft and warm, and stylish . However, this product failed me when I depended on it most to protect me from the winter elements. 5 minutes into wearing this it started feeling cold to me. I thought it was because I was outside in 3 degree winter weather. This wasn’t the case. I went back inside to warm up and when I removed the Omni Gaiter it was indeed wet. I’m so disappointed in this product because now I have a purchased a product to keep me warm that does the opposite. I dried it out and tried again when it wasn’t snowing anymore but once again the Gaiter gets wet only after a few minutes. I’m definitely disappointed because I need something that keeps me warm and dry while outside facing the elements.
review.name: Trail Shaker Omni Gaiter - Disappointed
comment: Thanks for sharing your experience with us, this is not something we like to see. Please check out our warranty information by scrolling to the bottom of the page and clicking warranty.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good neck gaiter that's warm and lightweight. Great color.
review.name: Warm, lightweight, and good coverage.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a high tech neck gator with the Omni heat lining. I wore it in 0° wind chill and the wind did not penetrate and my face was kept warm. Highly recommend!
review.name: Works better than any scarf!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this gator and it’s keeping me warm. It can be a bit claustrophobic when putting on (I’ve never worn a gator) but it’s light and doesn’t bother me when it’s on. It’s very light and I forget I’m wearing it. It’s keeping me a lot warmer than I used to be — especially in the cold, windy weather here in Chicago.
review.name: Great fit, comfort and keeps me warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This neck gaiter is light weight but holds the warmth so well.  Working outside in the sub zero weather keeps me warm!
review.name: Sub zero weather

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very sleek design. Looks really good and also does a great job at keeping you warm. Would definitely recommend.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product sucks it pulls my facial hair and and this shiny foil like inside gets cold against my bare skin. It fits too tight.
review.name: Horrible product
comment: We are sorry to hear the quality for this item was not as expected. If we can further assist in getting you connected with a new size or alternate product, please contact our Customer Care support team via phone or chat.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Not very warm. Builds up moisture which is gross. Exhales cool breath.
review.name: Not too warm
comment: Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback. We will make sure this is passed along to the appropriate teams regarding opportunities for improvement on this product. Thank you for choosing Columbia!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love it, super cozy and warm you cannot go wrong with this one if you are looking for a gaiter to keep you next warm on those cold days.
review.name: Warm and cozy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’m absolutely impressed with this product! It provides excellent protection for my neck area, completely shielding me from cold winds and harsh weather. The material is soft, warm, and breathable, so it’s super comfortable to wear for long periods. Whether I’m out for a walk, commuting, or even doing outdoor activities, it keeps me cozy without feeling bulky. Plus, the design is stylish and pairs well with my winter wardrobe. If you’re looking for something to keep the chill away, this is definitely a must-have!
review.name: Say Goodbye to Chilly Winds!

name: Trail Shaker Neck Gaiter

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these Boots with my actual size of a 10.5, but I have a wide foot so I got the wide. Something most manufacturers don't offer. The fit is perfect, they're very warm, maybe too warm that's why I wear it with a light sock. They look great.
review.name: Happy customer

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these boot because my North Face boots were hurting my feet. My Newton Ridge boots, however, did not disappoint. They're warm and comfortable. Great for wearing everyday.
review.name: Newton Ridge boots

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My all time favorite boot for work and every day. I've been wearing this same boot for work as a hotel maintenance person for years, I wear a pair out and just order another. They're the best combination I've found of lightweight, waterproof, comfortable and affordable boot I've found to suit my purposes.
review.name: Best boots

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband has always had a problem finding shoes that fit his feet , are comfortable to wear and last for more than a year. He loves these shoes. The style and materials used to make these boots hit all the marks. When they say wide they mean it. He can wear them all day long even when his feet swell and still be comfortable. He had me order another pair in a different color he loved them so well. A first for me.
review.name: Perfection

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really comfortable right out of the box.   Did a small section of the Colorado Trail.  They are great.
review.name: Great boots

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Although the boots look great, The width was just too narrow, and I ordered a wide. All my other Columbia boots have been awesome.
review.name: Good looking but too narrow

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Columbia stated shoes to Wide Width, They weren't even close
review.name: Wrong Fit

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very surprised overall .Very comfortable with an amazing fit .
My feet have hiked over 4000 miles so they are gnarly to say the least .
The 10 wide was an a+ fit.
I would buy them again for 2x the price.
I was reluctant without first wearing them as most would be.
review.name: Buying without trying there is this is first time

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This came as "Wide" but it is not very wide so I had to send it back.
review.name: Not very "wide" W
comment: Thank you for bringing this to our attention.  Please know that we are committed to improvement and If you'd like to discuss your concerns further, please reach out to us directly.

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wear this product for work and it is very comfortable right from the start. It keeps my feet dry in wet and muddy conditions. The support for my feet and knees is very good. I needed a new pair of Boots because old pair looked ok but I had pain in left knee and in the first week of wearing this Boot the knee pain went away.
 I am pleased with boot so far and the size is accurate and feels good from the start.
review.name: Newton Ridge Plus11 Suede Waterproof Hiking Boot

name: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great coat needs to have 2 way zipper especially if your in and out of a car as much as l am. Coat is NOT for extrem cold mid 20's your fine colder you may be cold too! All in all it's a nice coat.
review.name: My 2nd coat first one stollen

review.reviewBody: It's amazing for heavy weather and is extremely lightweight.
review.name: Got it off of Mercari. Completely new & goretex

review.reviewBody: Great jacket. Stylish and practical. Purchased the additional fleece for added warmth. Thinking about purchasing another one for my daughter.
review.name: If you're on the fence, just do it. You won't regret it.

review.reviewBody: This is my second Mountain Jacket. The first one was great and have high hopes for my second one.
review.name: Great Product

review.reviewBody: This is my second TNF Mountain Jacket. The first one was purchased in the late 1990s/early 2000s. It was great. I am expecting the same quality from this one.
review.name: Mountain Jacket

review.reviewBody: Great jacket!! Fits well with plenty of room in the mid section. The pockets are big and roomy there are 2 zipped pockets on the inside of the jacket. Jacket also has pit zips. The jacket length is also perfect for me. Jacket does a great job of keeping the wind and rain out.
review.name: I would recommend this jacket to anyone!

review.reviewBody: This jacket is awesome, I have been waiting for the gray color to come out for awhile
review.name: I hope more colors are added

review.reviewBody: Bought this jacket to replace an old NF jacket I had for about 20 years(!). I'm sure this new jacket will be great once I get out in the winter months and start using it, but only giving 3.5-4 stars right now because I'm questioning the sizing. I typically wear a Large (5'10, 195 lbs), but I tried both Large and Medium. I was drowning in the Large - it was 4-6" too long and I would have had to roll the sleeves over to fit. The Medium fits, but is about 1" too short, and the sleeve length feels too long. Is there a "Medium-and-a-half"? Bottom line, I wish it was more comfortable, but once I'm on the slopes, I'm sure it will be great...and I hope to keep it as long as I did my last NF jacket.
review.name: Size is a concern

review.reviewBody: I have used it, but not in all extreme conditions. I was going to throw mine away and it has only been dry cleaned. Now, I will keep it. It is very tough but catches lint when you store it!
review.name: No. There are better jackets from the North Face.

review.reviewBody: Really nice quality. Only suggestion would be to add a RFID pocket on the sleeve.
review.name: Sturdy and handsome jacket

review.reviewBody: The switch and vents rattle when in the closed position. This was the case for multiple models. If you listen to music while skiing or riding, it’s probably no big deal. That said, the loose switch and vents were going to get to me. Kinda’ like how once someone pointed out how JayZ goes, “uh,” and now it’s all I hear.
review.name: You won’t unhear the rattle…

review.reviewBody: Generally really like fit of Giro helmets. And for reference, my head fits most helmets for any sport I have needed one just fine. This model looks good online and in person and fit like others I have had in terms of circumference, but the rear adjustment dial was a couple inches lower than any previous giro, pinching into neck if, for example, in a tuck, or looking up.  Seems like could be really bad in an impact crash on the back of head, like from a high side, would drive the adjuster straight into back of neck.  Actually seems dangerous.  Trading in for a Jackson which fits like ones I have had in past.
review.name: Very  low rear adjustment wheel

name: Neo Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: I bought a half size up from street shoe after reading reviews. Break in was painful, but once broken in, I wish I bought my street size. Really love this shoe. Got the half size up resoled and will buy another pair in my street size when I can. All around great shoe if I’m feeling something more aggressive (though really not much) than my up moccs. Great for wide toe box/wide feet. Toe rubber great for toe hooks/bat hang stuff.
review.name: Great shoe. I wouldn’t size up.

review.reviewBody: I went up a half size from my normal adidas, great climbing shoe.... break in period is rough!
review.name: Gripped up!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very good shoe for "buldring". Progressiv but still high comfort.
review.name: High quality and nice price!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Get the sizes right. I normally wear 45, ordered 47 1/3 and it was still way too small. There was no bigger product size available
review.name: Dissappointing because the very wrong size

review.reviewBody: I bought them size 9.5, which is my street shoe size, I will buy the next pair smaller, maybe 8.5. Only because I like tight fitting around the heel. For heel hooks. Otherwise, the best shoes I have tried!
review.name: My new favorite shoe. Sock like fitting.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My go to shoe used to be the hiangle pro. Now the Crawe is. I get much more support edging and just feel overall stronger on footholds. They are slightly heavier but the extra padding feels great. Also my feet dont sweat as much in those. For size i went a half size up from my street shoes.
review.name: My favorite all rounders

review.reviewBody: Great shoe! Extremely comfortable! I severely over-pronate and finding a climbing shoe that’s comfortable and a tight enough fit is hard! These work perfect! Love them!
review.name: Great Shoe!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Solid all arounder. Size up. Good grip. Solid toe. Beefy.
review.name: Solid All Around Shoes

review.reviewBody:
Nice climbing  shoes
Size too small 
Beautiful design
review.name: Take 1.5 size up

review.reviewBody: I’m extremely happy with these shoes. After breaking them in they’re the comfiest pair I have. Sending them out to get resoled was hard on my soul. My only issue is getting sizing to buy a second pair isn’t possible. I check back weekly and it’s just never in stock.
review.name: Extremely happy with the shoes. Wish for stock.

name: Crawe Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: This is such a cute romper with great fabric but unfortunately the neck opening is too small to squeeze your body through. I normally wear a small but ordered a medium because I like a loose fit. But I couldn't get it on :( This romper needed a zipper.
review.name: Adorable romper but I couldn't squeeze into it!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this romper in a size L hoping it would be long enough for my body, but it was nowhere close. I even left a review for it but of course it doesn't show up because it wasn't favorable. So I sized up to an XL and it still isn't long enough for my torso! And it squishes my boobs because there is not stretch at all. Please can someone make cute rompers for people with long torsos and big boobs?!?
review.name: Not for Long Torsos or Big Boobs

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable, but wish I would have ordered a small, rather than a med. Read the reviews about being short through the center, but it is big on me. I am 5'5, 114 lbs and the medium is large on me.
review.name: Very comfortable, but wish I

review.reviewBody: I liked this romper. It was a little roomy for my petite body, but it works.
review.name: Roomy Romper

review.reviewBody: Hard to get on since it has no stretch. If you have any curves, you might struggle unless you size up.
review.name: Hard to get on since

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I thought this would be too short in the crotch, but there was room! Length was a little longer than expected, which I liked. I really thought it was going to be really short. Fabric is Tencel denim so a little thicker and doesnt have too much give. The fit is more relaxed to make up for the fabric type.
review.name: I thought this would be

review.reviewBody: Really cute! It shows my bra a little under my arm so maybe I got a size too big but I really do like them. Very comfy and cute! I love this company and all they stand for!
review.name: Really cute! It shows my

review.reviewBody: Cute romper. The color is beautiful and the fabric is soft and comfortable. I took the advice of others and sized up to a medium when I normally wear a small. The romper is very roomy, but the length is good. I think the romper would be too short if I ordered my typical size.
review.name: Cute, but size up!

review.reviewBody: I have no idea who wrote the previous positive reviews -- I am 5'5" (i.e. average height) and this is WAY too short in the inseam.  Returning it.  In addition, the fabric is scratchy after a single wash and there's no zipper to get into/out of it easily.  I have several Carve dresses from several year  ago -- they often get the design right, but not the details (dresses are cute, but seams are crooked).
review.name: Inseam way too short, scratchy

review.reviewBody: Super cute, great fit. Will be perfect for summer! I normally get a small, but got a medium. Happy I did as the crotch would have been too snug in the small. I'm 5'5, 140 lbs for reference.
review.name: Super cute, great fit. Will

hasVariant.name: AM503 Cycling Shoe - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano AM503 Cycling Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I typically wear an 11 in most shoes. I bought the 45.0 and 46.0 and ended up with the 45.0. Toes are pretty close to the end of the shoe, but the 46.0's had an extra 3/4" inch of space in the toe. One ride so far and I didn't notice any toe pressure/contact at the end since it's a clipless setup. If you plan to do lots of hike-a-biking or wear heavy socks for winter riding, the larger size may be the better option. 

FWIW - I'm coming from a Giro chamber II size EU45 US11 (excellent shoe that still looks almost new after 3 full years of riding). The Giro has a stiffer sole overall from toe to heel, whereas the AM5's sole is stiff in the toe-forefoot half and a bit more forgiving in the rear. The AM5 has a noticeably less bulky look. It also has more front to rear cleat adjustability, but the Giro's was completely sufficient as well.
review.name: Sizing

name: AM503 Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: The Nova3 is very comfortable and has ample room in the toe area. The support on my foot feels great. Have had many positive comments on the color scheme and asked where I found them.
review.name: Colorful

review.reviewBody: Great shoes. Very cpmfortable. Size fits perfectly.
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: I love these Nova 3 shoes. The red color is vibrant. Very comfortable with great grip. I use one pair to mow grass on a slight incline without any slippage at all; I wear the second pair all day when manning an old school BBQ pit.
review.name: Comfort and Color meets Practicality
comment: Thank you!

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable everyday shoe. I'm on my feet all day and they are awesome
review.name: Comfortable Shoe

review.reviewBody: Nice shoe - great sole for trail running. Not as comfortable as my old Novas, but lighter, I think. We'll see what my lower joints have to say after a month of trail running.
review.name: Novas were better, but Nova3's still a great shoe.
comment: Thank you for your rating!

review.reviewBody:
This is my fourth pair of Nova 3's from Merrell. They run a little small so I go up 1/2-1 size bigger. They are great trail shoes for forest floors. These are very slippery on damp stone or wood but normal woods, leaves, and other similar debris they handle like a champ. 

I alternate with hiking and trail jogging. They hold up structurally well. The insole loses support before the shoe loses tread.
review.name: Nova 3 Good Hikers

review.reviewBody:
Nova 3 is an excellent shoe. Period. It has a perfect transition from heel to arch and to the front of the foot while walking. It has a well-balanced cushion and it is light. I have two pairs, one is a regular and the second is a waterproof model with Gortex fabric. Great job Merrell.
I hope that Merrell will never discontinue this great product.
review.name: A perfect shoe.

review.reviewBody:
I bought these on the 20th of September with the intention of using them for trail running only. Life happened and I needed a comfortable shoe where I could do 10-20 miles a day as a political canvasser, while still getting a trail run on the weekend. It has been nearly 2 months since I have had these wearing 3-5 days out of the week, and I have worn the tread down to the under layer. Which is through mostly around the heel area. Mostly great... but...
The biggest complaint is the sliding foot bed / insole. The left side shoe being the worst, it creeps up the back of the heel, leaving my toes hanging over the front of the insole cushion, uncomfortable and awkward. An I have continued walking or running on it for 3-5 miles at a time before pulling it off to fix it, only to have it do it again shortly. 
Since I have worn the tread down so much, there is not much point in fixing them, so they are mostly getting relegated to yard shoes after less than two months to wear out the sole and having a wonky insole cushion on the left side. 

Disappointed
review.name: Flaw, or the norm? Creeping insoles

review.reviewBody: Haven't worn them a lot, yet. It's too hot. BUT, they will be going to Europe with me this spring!
review.name: Cute & comfy
comment: Thanks for the great review!

review.reviewBody: Great comfortable shoe that runs true to size and doesn’t squeak like the chameleon
review.name: Perfect sneaker

name: Nova 3 Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I brought circling short but the material great the leg part was too big and I normally wear a but the leg part was too wide
review.name: Cycling shorts

review.reviewBody: I bought this a little over a month ago and have wore multiple times. Love the fit and the comfort.
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody: The product does run slightly small, but overall I was really happy with the product. For reference I consider myself an athletic build 5'2"/135lbs with wider hips/thicker thighs. The material is comfortable and I went with the small. I was able to wear the product for a 12 mile mountain bike ride and was thankful I had them on (lots of rocks and roots). These will be my go to bike shorts for all my upcoming rides.
review.name: Yeti Chamois

review.reviewBody: I’m new to bike shorts and so glad I invested! The padding is well placed and greatly reduced my biking soreness right off the bat. I’m a big fan of the high waste for sun protection and compression. I’d say the shorts run true to size/small depending on your body type. I’d definitely recommend them overall, but consider ordering either your normal size or 1 size up. The fabric is super comfy and breathable. Looking forward to many rides in these!
review.name: Very comfy!

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of yeti liners.  I really appreciate the redesign.  The waist band is wide and high.  No more sunburn or exposed skin when riding.  The legs are long - thank you again Yeti.  I am tall and I hate liners that ride up.  Last but not least the liner is perfect.  No more saddle sores or rubbing.
review.name: Love the upgrades

name: Koda Liner - Women's

description: Buy the Assos Spring/Fall EVO Knee Warmer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Spring/Fall EVO Knee Warmer
hasVariant.description: Buy the Assos Spring/Fall EVO Knee Warmer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Spring/Fall EVO Knee Warmer
hasVariant.description: Buy the Assos Spring/Fall EVO Knee Warmer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Spring/Fall EVO Knee Warmer
hasVariant.description: Buy the Assos Spring/Fall EVO Knee Warmer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I don't know what it is, but it's hard to find good knee warmers. I tried Pearl Izumi's but those seem to be for people with normal calves and huge thighs. Then I tried another model from Assos but that developed a hole the first time I pulled them over my heel.

These are better than that. They do work and keep my old knees warm in cool weather. They do move a bit so a silicone band might be good addition to keep them in place. Also, after having worn them just three times they're developing a stretch mark/rip.

I ordered some long bibs and those are a bit easier.
review.name: OK. Starting to tear and creeps up a bit

review.reviewBody: Generally i like Asia brand, having owned a number of their products. These knee warmers fit nicely, provide just the right amount of insulation (light), were a good fit. After two road rides, i went to remove them and discovered the stitching on the interior of both was coming unraveled. I am hoping to return these under warranty, but am still awaiting contact from Competitive Cyclist 2 weeks later.
review.name: Nice product but poor durability
comment: Thank you for sharing your experience with the Assos Knee Warmers. We've emailed you to assist you with this situation

name: Spring/Fall EVO Knee Warmer

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Dragonfly Bikepack Tent: 1-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Dragonfly Bikepack Tent: 1-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Dragonfly Bikepack Tent: 1-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this over a year ago with the ground sheet for Kayaking and Bikepacking, I have had this tent in temperatures below 0 with ice on the outside of the tent in an English December, a little bit drafty with the higher fly, but worked fine. On a bikepacking trip with heavy rain, the tent stayed dry, however I did get a couple of drips come through the highest point where the clip attaches to the poles on the inner, Hopefully Iv resealed that now. The shorter poles help with packing, especially when bike packing, Having two vestibules I can use one side to partly cover my bike keeping it within the tent and insight. I'm a little concerned with the long term durability of the fly as it does seem to be very thin and I would recommend the ground sheet to protect this. Overall though I love this tent, if there was one thing I would change it would be the blend of the fabric, one is green and the other white and this does capture the light Iv noticed, making the tent less stealthy. if the white could be changed to a darker green then I feel the blend would work better.
review.name: Dragonfly Bikepacking 2P tent

review.reviewBody:
I offer to your attention an ultralight tent for traveling by bicycle or motorcycle.
Subjectively, it turned out to be the best option for me on the market of tourist equipment.



Pros:
1) Compactness due to the reduced bend of the arcs, the use of ultralight materials, and constructive solutions.
2) New updated OSMO fabric from Nemo. Which is a mixture of polyester and nylon, as a result, I took the best from the two of them.
3) Internal organization and space. Spacious vestibule.
4) Small things that facilitate operation and installation (For example, color coding, hinges for doors, Lending Zone for the vestibule)
5) The bedroom is protected around the perimeter by a draft-proof fabric.

Cons:
1) Bag for mounting on the steering wheel and transportation.
2) The price is due to the bag, and in general the price is not democratic)
3) Pegs that are far from Ultralite.
4) The price footprint, which also cannot be attributed to the Ultralite series

In general, the pluses more than cover the minuses, which in fact the majority will be able to solve or simply ignore because they are not significant. You can live.
review.name: The best tent for a cycling trip

review.reviewBody: The new dragonfly bikepacking tent is a complete downgrade. This bag is made of cheaper material compared to the previous year. This recent model is comparable to a cheap polyster sleeping bag. Additionally, the fabric of the tent itself is almost paper thin. The footprint mat went from being optional to an absolute requirement with today's quality of the tent
review.name: Downgrade in quality
comment: Thank you for leaving a review! One of the changes with the new Dragonfly™ Bikepack OSMO™ Backpacking Tent is that it is made of our OSMO™ fabric. The OSMO™ fabric does have a different feel but does offer 4x better water repellency and 3x less stretch when wet. OSMO™ fabric is made from 100% recycled yarns that are PFAS-free and meet flame retardancy standards without the use of added chemicals. We're always looking for ways to improve our tents and OSMO™ fabric is just one of our innovations!

review.reviewBody:
Have had this tent since early this year and absolutely love it after having spent about 20 nights in it so far. I've used it in Iceland, Kyrgyzstan, and stateside with a few overnights and a nearly two week long trip. Inevitably had a few nights of very heavy rain and high wind and it managed super well!

I opted for the 2P since I'm 6'6" and prefer having the extra space, in bad weather the additional indoor space goes a long way in making early mornings more comfortable. 

Packability is very good too, I ended up putting it in a few different places on my bike depending on the length of trip. To my surprise the somewhat shorter poles did feel like they increased flexibility when packing my bike. 

Also worth mentioning how easy this tent is to set up, always just a few minutes even with the rainfly. When you’re exhausted this will be appreciated. 

So far very impressed, looking forward to more trips with this tent!
review.name: Perfect for overnights and long multi-days

review.reviewBody: I was so excited when the Osmo came out because I have the prior version of the Dragonfly Bikepack 2P tent and its only weakness was the rain fly. So I “upgraded” to the Osmo thinking I would get the same great quality tent with a better rain fly. Boy was I wrong. The only thing good about the OSMO is the rain fly. The quality of all the other materials is very poor. I’m very careful with my gear since I want it to last a long time, and never had any problems with the older model. After packing the OSMO for my first trip (3 weeks on the GDMBR), I was horrified to pull out the tent the first night and find several small holes in the mesh and upper tent material where (I presume) the plastic hooks abraded the material. Also, the one of the loops that hold the cargo tray on each side was seam sealed shut, so completely unusable. As my trip continued, I attempted to pack the tent differently in order to avoid the abrasions, but nothing worked. Nemo also got rid of the nice big pockets in the front sides of the tent, which I used a lot in the older version. I also had to be very careful about removing the poles from where they snap into the plastic hooks at the corners of the tent because the round tip of the pole would often pull out of the pole. Thankfully I bought this tent at REI and I will be returning it ASAP. I will be switching to a different brand now that the quality of the Nemo tent has become so poor.
review.name: “Upgraded” from the older version: Big mistake!
comment:
We are sorry to hear about small holes in the mesh and tent body. NEMO strives to provide high-quality products that meet the diverse requirements of our customers. To ensure the best camping experience, it's important to consider factors like tent durability, weather resistance, and proper usage guidelines. While our tents are designed to withstand various conditions, it's possible that the specific circumstances of your trip exceeded the capabilities of the tent.

We would like to bring your tent in for an inspection and repair. We will reach out to you separately to see if you would like to start a warranty claim.

name: Dragonfly Bikepack Tent: 1-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I enjoy how sleek the check in bag looks. The wheels are really smooth. However i find the handle shaky at times and the shell its too easily scratched. I have over 15 scratches after one trip

review.reviewBody: This check-in bag can fit so much inside. The organization alone makes this bag worth the money. Happy with my purchase!

review.reviewBody: This check-in bag can fit so much inside. The organization alone makes this bag worth the money.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Although the Olive Drab color looks a bit dark gray. I wanted an unusual color that would stand out. Other than that it has a lot of room inside. It rolls easy. Haven’t actually used it in air travel but, only on a car vacation. It’s seems heavy duty enough to care for belongings.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I ordered the part while speaking to a rep on the phone. I made it clear that the wheel was for my carry on luggage not my checked luggage. The part fits but over hangs so it’s not clean.
review.name: Wrong part

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased this for trips to visit family, especially where I need to load up with stuff for the grandkids ;). The Check-In was heavy when filled, but tracked well and rolled smoothly. I've borrowed other people's similar size suitcases and did not have the same experience. Well made and set up well for organizing a trip. I highly recommend it!
review.name: Love this Suitcase!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I can jam so much into this case, due to the interior retaining straps, etc. Moves easily. Great case. You won’t regret this purchase.
review.name: Takes a beating, looks amazing.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was so excited about this luggage for so long, only to be very disappointed with it. :(. After just one trip it looks like the check in is 3 years old. It scratches very easily and came off the plane with all sorts of colors scratched in from all the other luggage it must have been thrown around with. I would not recommend spending this amount of money for this bag.
review.name: Not worth it

review.reviewBody: I have taken this several times now and it’s as perfect as checked luggage can be. It’s efficient, clean, and extremely protective.
review.name: Protection, efficiency, looks great

review.reviewBody: The Red Chili Sausalito may be the most comfortable climbing shoe I've ever owned. But they aren't durable. I've only had them for 2 months and the rand is completely worn through. I maybe only got 30 total pitches out of them (I didn't wear them in the gym).
review.name: Super comfortable, terrible durability

review.reviewBody:
Pros:

Ideal for wide feet
Extremely comfortable
True to street shoe size
Attractive design


Cons:

Very poor performance
Almost no friction
Lacks power
Never filled me with confidence


While the Red Chili Sausalito shoes are comfortable and fit well, they fall short in performance. They might be suitable for traditional climbers, but I would not recommend them for beginner sport climbers, which was my intended use. These shoes never filled me with confidence.

If you decide to try them, make sure to size them according to your street shoe size. I upgraded to the Red Chili Fusions, and I highly recommend those instead for sport climbing.
review.name: Comfortable but not for sport climbing

review.reviewBody: Great shoes for beginners. Good grip on a boulder and very comfortable from first day. The only issue is that after wearing them a few times they stretch a size. The company advises to buy true to size but I would still go a half size or a full size down.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Got these while my Anasazi pinks were being resoled to be my backup pair. I wanted my backup shoes to be something extra comfortable, as I was also not long after healing from a broken foot.

These live up to the comfy reputation of Red Chilis, especially if normally you find a lot of climbing shoes to be particularly tight and uncomfortable. Even with my Mortons toe, I feel zero discomfort. Seriously, they feel like just putting on a pair of Adidas sneakers.

That said, comparing to the pinks in performance -- which is a high standard to compare to -- they obviously fall a little short, even ignoring the less-aggressive fit. Oddly both the "feel" is a bit damped and yet the sole could be a little stiffer IMO, which makes it not as precise on delicate edges. The general comfort works in its favor for jamming in cracks, especially in a long crack route, but the lack of stiffness works against it. Smears feel good though.

Overall though, I probably end up wearing these more than my pinks. I'll put on the pinks when I'm projecting or whatnot, but these are so comfy for casual climbing. Especially for longer sessions.
review.name: Sneaker-like comfort

review.reviewBody:
I love these guys! I got them on sale and have been using them for the past year. I got a more relaxed fit, still snug, but not curly those toes. They work beautifully! I typically use them up to the 5.10+ range and they perform solidly even on tiny edges. I thought the rubber was a little too hard at first, but after a decent amount of use, it softens up and gets really grippy. Great for slab due to the flexible sole, and relatively good in cracks. Lacks the ankle protection of the tc's, but still doesn't hurt your feet while doing foot jams. 

My only regret is not resoling them sooner :/ I just had 2 holes start through the right toebox and ended any shot I had at getting more mileage out of them.
review.name: "The Budget TC Pros" My Red Ferrari Shoe

name: Sausalito Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: Feathers are sticking out from all over the jacket. I am very disappointed with this brand.
review.name: Poor quality

review.reviewBody:
Bought this in Navy Large. It is VERY warm it will not be that way for long. This jacket molts, all the time. I am constantly picking down from the panels as the feathers poke through. At least that is one feather at a time, tonight there was down sticking out from a seam and before I was done I literally had a ball of down the size of a golf ball in my hand.  

Once again, I love Patagonia and have closet full, but this jacket is a serious mistake.
review.name: Big Patagonia Fan...but

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket in black and was shocked upon receiving it that unlike the pictures shown on the website it’s not a true black. It’s more of dark grey or at the very least a washed out black. Also, for the price that I paid the quality is very cheap. It has shed feathers from the stuffing since I first started wearing it. There are literal feathers sticking out of the seams all over the jacket. I’m blown away at how low quality this jacket is. It even feels cheap. I’ve gotten better quality puffer jackets at cheap chain stores. I would discourage anyone from buying this jacket. Just because you’re paying more for it doesn’t mean that the quality is there.
review.name: Poor quality especially for the price

review.reviewBody:
I'm 6'2", 155lbs tall/slim build (think runner). I'm usually between a size M or L depending on the brand of clothing, but Mediums from Patagonia usually fit really well for me, including a Torrentshell 3L rain jacket. For whatever reason the Down jackets fit differently than other Patagonia jackets. I tried a medium first, and while it fit really well in the shoulders and chest, the sleeves were slightly shorter than I preferred. After wearing it for a bit I found myself constantly tugging at the bottom of the jacket. I feel like the medium needed to be JUST 1 inch longer in the body of the jacket and it would have been great. 

Returned the Medium and purchased a Large, thinking that would fit better. However, when the Large arrived I had the opposite problem. Fit great in the length of the body and sleeves but was way too big in the chest/waist (looked like I was wearing a barrel). 

If you are a slim build, or usually between sizes, this may not be the jacket for you. Learn from my mistake and order both sizes that you are usually between in this jacket to compare the fit at the same time instead of having to wait for things to ship to and fro.
review.name: Poor Fit - Returned

review.reviewBody: I cannot give a review on the jacket itself other than first impressions of it. Jacket runs a tiny bit smaller than other brands, my husband is usually a Small. Ordered that size and it fit but layering anything other than a t-shirt under it made the jacket bulge. Tried a size up at an REI store and that was comically large. Main reason he didn't like it is that it felt cheap. He commented that the zipper felt like it would break quickly. Ended up returning and purchasing a different brand that had same fill and pack ability but felt like better quality. Also, didn't pay attention when first ordering from Backcountry but was a little shocked they charged $7 for return shipping. Would've expected a lower price or even free when spending this much on gear. Hopefully they fulfill the return quickly as it's been 5 days since shipped. Probably won't buy from again unless I know that I won't need to return.
review.name: Returned

review.reviewBody:
I was skeptical of its durability and light weight. I would not wear it to clear brush (for fear of tearing it), but it quickly became my “go to” jacket for cold days.  Much light weight - almost feels like you are not wearing “enough” coat- but warmer than much heavier coats I own. 

I was so happy with it, now three family members have them.  Exceeded my expectations.
review.name: Worth it!

review.reviewBody: Warm, lightweight, comfortable, compressible, and fashionable. It's a great jacket. Seems to be warm enough for 30-degree temperatures. Only time will tell if the quality and craftsmanship are built to last. Fingers crossed.
review.name: Keep it Simple

review.reviewBody: Fits a little bit large as I have a size between M and L. I took L for the extra length.
review.name: Warm and light

review.reviewBody: Be warned, the stock photo for the Sedge Green is WAY different than in person. Its basically eucalyptus. Both are much lighter in person. VERY light green on the bottom. Second color I've ordered with this jacket and looks like I'll be returning both and giving up on it! Bummer. Other than the color seems like a good jacket. Super soft.
review.name: Bad stock photo for Sedge Green

review.reviewBody: Great jacket for almost any conditions, from layering under a ski shell to around town.  I have worn the down sweater for years and love its style and versatility.  I like that Patagonia is now using fully recycled materials to make it! #backcountrygearhead
review.name: Can't beat it!

review.reviewBody: I have several other pairs of mountain biking shorts and these are always my first choice. The material feels high quality and has perforations in some areas for extra ventilation. The included belt is perfect for keeping them in place. I also love the zipper pockets! Perfect for quicker rides when I only want to carry my keys and phone.
review.name: First choice

review.reviewBody: Shorts look great, but they ride up your legs and crotch when riding, pretty uncomfortable. Happy with the size, but the fit is all off.
review.name: Cute, but Terrible Fit

review.reviewBody: The sizing is a touch more snug than the previous version of these (which I loved). I returned bc I like to have my phone in my pocket. With the 7” the zipper can close wedging my phone (reg iphone13 for size) under it, but the pocket isn’t deep enough so the phone sits at the hip bone and makes it uncomfortable to pedal.
review.name: A little off

review.reviewBody: If you’re new to mountain biking, get these. I bought an older version of these that Backcountry makes and put them through the ringer! From Moab to NC to California they were my go tos. When they finally kicked the bucket I got these right away. I’ve only used them a few times but there are even more design improvements. I love the 7 inchers bc they work with the Covert liner. Fit true to size for me!
review.name: Amazing Intro Shorts

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket.  Thin and warm with the usually great style from Ortovox.  My only complaint is that, like most Ortovox gear, it is very tight as it’s designed for a  technical mid layer.  I had hoped this would be a unique all around fleece jacket, but unless you’re Euro skinny imthe fit is off.  I am 6’2 and 195lbs.  The XL is VERY tight but is functional and looks good under a shell
review.name: Excellent for its intended purposes.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Long Flex Tips online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These made my poles new again. Can’t say enough about Black Dimond and the amazing parts they provide
review.name: Replaced tips

review.reviewBody:
Have had my BD Trailback poles since '20 and they have thousands of miles on them. 

These "Long" model tips do not slide all the way onto the poles. So after a couple hundred miles the very end of the tips were bending and one finally broke. My original tips didn't do that and lasted forever. I found a BD pole in a river crossing this summer that had the same exact issue with the tip as well.

I see by the product # and description these are the "long" model. It looks like the "short" model is no longer sold?? Judging by one review here there used to be a short model tip.

 BD needs to be more specific about what poles these tips are compatible with. Or BD needs to provide more detailed instructions, maybe that the new tips need to be put in hot water before installing, or maybe something else to get these tips to slide on all the way. Are my poles not compatible with these "long" tips? Just sliding the new tips on and banging the pole on the floor per the instructions DOES NOT get these tips on all the way.

In had to buy the short Leki tips for my poles. They didn't fit perfectly but fit well enough that the ends of the tips had zero issue with bending and prematurely breaking.

Breaking a tip on a thru hike can be a major pain and the old tips are definitely not as easy to get off as the comments here suggest in my experience.
review.name: Don't work with all poles?

review.reviewBody: Thanks for stocking these, this is now the third time that I've kept my 15 yr old poles from the landfill.
review.name: Third repair

review.reviewBody: These tips are light weight, but they tend to bend and break easily. Trying to use these with a Dynafit binding to turn the binding can cause them to break easily.
review.name: Bend and break easily

review.reviewBody: Love my Black Diamond poles and this makes my right pole whole again.
review.name: Exactly what I needed...

review.reviewBody: Customer service was great, shipping was quick, and installation was a breeze!
review.name: Great Tips for Carbon Ski Poles

review.reviewBody: The replacement tips for the trekking poles arrived quickly and were very easy to replace. I bought 2 pair so that I would already have spares on hand.
review.name: Easy Tip Replacement

review.reviewBody: Easy to install using the provided clear instructions. Trekking pole ready for many more miles of use.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Happy hiker! Works as advertised. Will buy again, a long time from now. Thanks.
review.name: Happy hiker! Works as advertised.

review.reviewBody: Easy to install, I keep an extra flex tip and an extra basket in my hiking backpack. On-trail repairs are quick and easy.
review.name: Easy to install, I keep

name: Long Flex Tips

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I just recently got my hiking backpack, which I my first. I have to say the Aircontact  core is not only the nicest backpack I've ever had but it's the most comfortable as well. There is so much room inside and also has a very sturdy backbone to keep the back from sagging. There is also an airway down the back to keep your nice and cool. Looking forward to going on a nice hike with my awesome backpack.
review.name: Awesome backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Deuters Aircontact Core 50+10 in graphite shale is the perfect color pack for the rugged outdoorsman such as myself who has a problem keeping things 'clean looking'. I couldn't be happier with the massive size of this park or the abundance of pockets it has. But, my favorite part about this backpack is how comfortable it is! The air mesh ventilation system makes sweat minimal. I'm very fond of the fanny pack type pocket by your hip that makes carrying and accessing your essentials effortless. You'll have no problem fitting everything you need in here. The adjustable straps help craft the perfect fit to your back. Overall this is a super premium, well crafted product.
review.name: Well Crafted

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great hiking pack! It’s very nice looking and has a lot of room to pack your things. It’s super light weight, weighing only 4 lbs 12oz. It has nice padding and is the most comfortable pack I’ve ever used. Highly recommend.
review.name: Hike in Comfort!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is such a great back pack for camping and hiking. It is very easy to set up and use. The material is strong and sturdy. It weather proof. It has back support with comfy cushion areas for support. It also has lots of pockets. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a pack back for hiking or camping.
review.name: Nice!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am so amazed how much the Deuter Aircontact Core 50 + 10 pack has to offer. This pack is truly amazing with a lot of pockets and space, both inside and out to store items and has gear loops too. It has a beautiful thought-out Y frame for distributing the weight equally and it's easy to adjust the straps and hip/wait straps as well. This pack is very sturdy and comfortable and the main compartment is spacious and deep for packing a good number of items, and there's also a separate bottom compartment too. There's even a small strap loop on one of the straps to hang your sunglasses on which is pretty awesome. Also on the back part of the pack there is a gear detachable straps to be able to attach larger items and the side pockets can hold a large tumbler or jug of water, which is amazing. There's is so much more to say about this pack but honestly this is such a great pack not only for hiking but to use for camping, traveling on road trips. I highly recommend this Deuter Aircontact Core 50 + 10 pack not only to family and friends but to all that want to have a great quality pack.
review.name: Extremely comfortable and sturdy!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Aircontact Core 50+10 - graphite-shale Is perfect. It is easy to setup. Easy to use. Great design, i will definitely be recommending to all my friends and family. I absolutely love it and will be using it very often,
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comes assembled right out of the box and ready to use. Super lightweight and holds a lot of items. It's a great quality pack, and super durable. The shoulder straps are very comfortable and adjust easily. 
I highly recommend this great quality product!
review.name: Great Product!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So I really like my new backpack thing. I'm not sure what the proper name for it is but I know it has a lot of pockets and zippers. It has great support for your back. I can't wait to try it out when we go camping and hiking. I really like how it's designed.
review.name: Nice backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently received the aircontact Core 50+ 10 hiking bag by Deuter. This bag is absolutely amazing for hiking or camping. The straps aren’t uncomfortable and adjust perfect yo your fitting, there is so many types of storage and zippers as well. I also enjoy how there is a Fanny pack near the bottom that can hold important items such as your cell phone or maps. i loved the color, and the quality is amazing for the price I would definitely buy. I’m obsessed with this bag. I couldn’t ask for a better one, I could fit all my gear and everything in it and I have had no problems! Love this
review.name: AMAZING for hiking!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This first thing I will say about this pack is that it is very comfortable. This is great for hiking and traveling. The gear straps can be positioned to attach a wide range of items. The Y-shaped frame and hip fins wrap around the hips and lumber pad really do distribute the weight you carry. Some great features are: walking pole holder, material loops on front & lid, load adjustment straps, elasticated inner compartment for wet items, lid compartment, removable backpack lid, separate compartment with removable base, hip fins with pockets, key clip; just to name a few. This backpack has so many zippered compartments to store everything you need with making it accessible, versatile and comfortable.
review.name: Awesome pack

name: Aircontact Core 50+10L Backpack

review.reviewBody: These are lovely - they are 100% wool, soft and in cute colors. I pay a seamstress to put long zippers on mine and it improves them immeasurably. I wish that the company would offer a zipper option for these sweaters.
review.name: A zipper would be nice

review.reviewBody: I love this sweater.   I bought the navy geo on sale.  It looks great with jeans or leggings or out to dinner.   I ordered an xs first and had to send it back as it was too tight across the back.  I wonder if it was just a bad one as I am very slim/petite across the shoulders.   I ordered a small and although it is not as slim as I would like through the body, I still really like it.   I will buy another if it goes on sale.
review.name: Cozy and warm

review.reviewBody:
I absolutely love these, so much so, that I purchased all three colors as they went on sale. They are so cozy to wear, almost like being wrapped in a blanket all day. 
I purchased my regular size and it fits well, although the sleeves are a little long. It does pill a bit, strangely the brown and grey stripped one pills the worse of the three colors, but it?s also my favorite. 
Although expensive, they were definitely worth the cost and will get a lot of wear.
review.name: Super Cozy!

review.reviewBody: Santa brought me one of these.  Great looking and wonderfully fitting sweater.  Lots of opportunities to wear, whether as a sweater, coat, or cool weather wrap.   Really like the way it fits and how it can be worn dressed up or dressed down.
review.name: Beautiful, versatile and functional!

name: Merino Heartfelt Hoodie - Women's
